content:
Posted: August 30, 2014
												This is one of those classic must own games on steam.The game premise revolves around being able to choose between four characters - and a certain gun set such as machine guns and shotguns. Multiple zombie hoards come attacking you wave after wave and can stop suddenly. Which sets this game apart from other zombie games is there is certain zombie types in this game. One guy as a tongue that stretches out and grabs people, another guy is a big fat blob who goes around puking on people and attracting zombies to them (and when he dies he blows up)! The game is set up as FPS with the player having the ability to heal themselves (while being not able to shoot) or heal their partner. The best game setting for me personally was the ability to play humans vs zombies where you take charge of one of the special zombie types.RATING :  7.65/10Gameplay B Story / Campaign B- Visuals / User Interface B- Sounds / Music B- Replay-ability B- Overall  B-

content:
Posted: February 8, 2013
												Este juego no es como la paja, que al menos divierte jugar solo. Está pensado para jugar con amigos/amigos de amigos o randoms si es que te gusta tratar con completos desconocidos. El tema es que, como todo juego MP de Valve, la community en general es un asco, llena de parásitos que se creen "pr0", cuando la realidad es que tienen 5000 horas porque son pobres y un día se les dio la mágica la posibilidad de comprar este juego por, como mucho, 5U$s. Obviamente todo esto previo jugar otras 5000 horas en servers No-Steam, llena de comandos pelotudos y mensajes cuando entrás, seguramente algunos subliminales de corte peronista.El único modo que vale la pena, en mi opinión, es el versus (4vs4), donde está el plus de la competencia. El modo campaña es una ♥♥♥♥♥♥ que consiste en ir de un punto a otro para terminar en un auto/blindado/barco/avión/heli/armario. Y los otros dos están porque había que poner algo, uno es el genérico survival y el otro es simplemente una cagada que ni recuerdo como se llama.Es agradable si te encontrás un grupito de gente copada para jugarlo cada tanto, ya que usualmente te tienen que bancar por más que seas un reverendo hijo de♥♥♥♥♥♥ debido a que casi siempre falta gente y no da jugar con un slot libre porque los bots son como simios con autismo y entonces se desbalancea todo.Si no encontrás al menos 7 entes vivientes o 3 si te gusta la ♥♥♥♥♥♥, recomiendo tener amor propio y jugar a otra cosa, y si sos pobre y no tenés otro juego jugá al TF2 que es F2P y volvete más mogólico pero con la posibilidad de tradear y dejar de serlo.

number of helpful: 5 of 5 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 14, 2015
												Left 4 Dead 2 is a game where four survivors attempt to survive and escape the zombie horde.If they survive or not, is up to you, and how you play.Left 4 Dead 2 manages to be fast-paced in a genre of slow zombie survivals, but it also still manages to retain the tense and stressful nature of the rest of the zombie games. There is no aim down sights in the game, unless you are using a sniper rifle, similar to the rest of Valve's games. Another thing in line with the rest of Valve's work is the lack of regenerating health. In Left 4 Dead 2, players must use first aid kits in order to heal themselves, with adrenaline shots and painkillers acting as 'temporary' health. Much of your survival depends on how well you utilize your first-aid...Do you save it in case something goes wrong, do you use it on someone else, or do you use it like it's the last chance you'll ever get...? Will you ever find more down the road? These are the questions you'll quickly ask yourself and the rest of your party as you try to make it through.Other than the healing items, there are various other items to keep an eye out for as well. Pipe bombs, molotovs, and even a jar of bile. Pipe bombs draw standard zombies to them with a loud beeping sound and a bright red light. In Left 4 Dead, loud sounds will attract zombies, and the pipe bomb in particular will keep them away from you, and will eventually kill them when it explodes. The molotov is a simple but effective weapon in keeping the horde away, it puts down a field of fire and it burns enemies. The last item is the bile jar. It attracts the horde to anything you throw it at, and they'll stay on it for a while, killing whatever it happens to land on. Even other zombies.The jar is filled with the insides of a boomer, one of the special infected of the game. The special infected of Left 4 Dead 2 are zombies with unique abilities that will prove deadly to survivors, and will require cooperation or a skilled shot to take down. Perhaps both..The Boomer is a large zombie that vomits on survivors. This attracts the horde of generic zombies to attack them. However, if the survivors are not careful in dispatching the boomer, it will explode on death and splatter on the survivors, turning a situation from bad to worse.The Hunter is a fast and agile zombie with a normal body frame, making it slightly harder to distinguish than other special infected when running. However, when it gets into a crouching position, it pounces on survivors and claws them until they die. It can pounce from very high locations to do extra damage, or it can ambush survivors from unexpected places. The Hunter wears a hoodie, and growls when getting ready to attack, screaming loudly when pouncing.The Smoker is a tall zombie that coughs a lot. That's why you don't smoke, because then you'll get lungs like this guy.Anyways, the smoker has long reach, allowing it to pull survivors around, and into dangerous positions. Smokers will try to pull you into a car alarm to draw the horde to you, or they will try to pull you to another special infected so they can try to pick off another survivor, or maybe they'll just pull a survivor off a ledge, either getting them stuck holding it for their life, or forcing the victim to run all the way back to their group.The Tank is a large, massive, and powerful zombie that can kill the entire group if left unchecked. They have huge muscles, which makes them an easy target, but it also represents their strength. One punch from a tank, and you'll fly several feet away from the rest of the survivors, and, on high difficulties, it could even end you in one hit. They can even toss rubble at the survivors, giving them a range option, as well as already being lethal in close quarters.The Jockey is a small zombie, he runs fairly quickly and jumps on survivors, 'riding' them away into danger.The Spitter is a taller type of special infected that spits acid onto survivors, being an effective long range unit that can deny an area to the survivors, or flush them out. Spitters also drop a pool of acid when they die, making them a bit more dangerous to deal with, especially when you are being pressured by a large amount of zombies.The Charger is a large zombie that literally charges survivors. They run at the survivors with full speed and once they pick up a target, they continue running for a while, or until they hit something. This makes them very dangerous in situations where they can thrust you off of a dangerous height, or if there's deep water, because they can sacrifice themselves and take you with them.Now, we've covered all of the special infected, and there's also uncommon infected as well, but I won't go over them here in order to save some space, and they aren't too important anyways.The gunplay in Left 4 Dead 2 is very easy to get used to. From assault rifles, shotguns, pistols, melee weapons, snipers, and even grenade launchers, players should find it simple to point and shoot at zombies. Headshots are obviously more rewarding, as it will kill them zombie faster, and you'll save some ammo too. There are different deployable ammo types as well, which have different properties. High explosive, for example, will explode!In Left 4 Dead 2, there are events in the game where you have to do something very loud in order to progress, but they draw a LOT of attention. These are called 'Crescendo Events'. These actions cause a massive attack from the infected, and require the survivors to defend themselves until the action is completed. Some events are gauntlet styled, which require survivors to run, rather than wait. Zombies will keep spawning in these gauntlet styled events, so it's best to move quickly. Also, at the jukebox, there's a song that plays and it says 'All we wanna do is eat your brains', which will also spawn enemies.When a survivor dies, you can rescue them in closets through the game, or revive them with a defibrillator. However, you can rescue them before that and revive them when they are down. Going down too often without using first aid will result in death, which can be noted when the screen turns grey. Some game modes disable spawning, so it may be suited for super serious players.At the end of every campaign, there is a final chapter, a finale.In the end, survivors hold out until rescue arrives, and this is the last stand for the campaign.Whoever dies here, is dead at the end, and at least one survivor must escape.Being prepared is extremely important here, as it will require determination from all survivors.Occasionally, the finale will also require the survivors run through another 'gauntlet' styled attack, except the finales are far more dangerous than the standard events, featuring more enemies and lots of special infected.I recommend getting the game for CO-OP, it's great at what it does, which is being a great CO-OP experience.For the single players, I honestly have trouble with recommending this game because there simply isn't enough to justify getting it just to play with the AI. The AI is extremely dumb, and they have HORRIBLE reaction times, occasionally letting you take massive amounts of damage before they save you, and not bothering to shoot the special infected, but instead they try to melee them when they are on you, making them waste valuable seconds needed to save your life. There's also not really a real story, other than backstories about the survivors and backstories about the other stuff around you. While some people have grown into the characters of L4D, I personally have not cared about any one of them enough to feel connected with the game itself. The soundtrack is also not really worth mentioning, in my opinion. It has a nice attempt at trying to place a dark feeling, but it's simply average at best. Gameplay also becomes monotonous without friends and workshop content, but you'll get a lot of replayability.

content:
Posted: April 3, 2016
												Left 4 Dead 2. This video game has brought me an adventurous experience.Gameplay: The gameplay is enjoyable. The different game modes are wonderful. The weapons are well-balanced. The zombies are used wisely. In certain situations where you raise an alarm or attempt to escape a specific area, the zombies will run fast and this immerses players in an actual zombie apocalypse. The Special Infected are amazing. Their special abilities can cause players to feel frustrated. However, this motivates players to work together to defeat them. The ability to add mods to the gameplay is absolutely outstanding. You can change your style of play.Setting: The story is well written. It is set in a zombie apocalypse. The characters in the story have a decent backstory although they could have been provided with more character development. With abandoned buildings and highways filled with cars, the maps are designed nicely. Thoughts: The video game feels short and repetitive. More maps and challenges could have been added to the story. After the finale of Dead Center, it would be fun if players could drive the car. A challenge where the players can rescue other isolated survivors could have been used as well. This develops the interaction between the survivors.Verdict: This video game is simply fantastic and worth the money. If you are a fan of zombie apocalypses, this video game is the one for you. Playing the video game by yourself is fun but it is better to play it with friends.

content:
Posted: March 29, 2016
												OK, so I was gifted this game after being on the fence for many years about purchasing it, and I'm kicking myself... for not getting it sooner. It is a good single player effort but the multiplayer is almost perfect. The worst thing about this game is the community. But don't let that discourage you. I was lucky enough to find a group of guys and gals who play games for the fun and friendship and don't really care if you aren't a perfect player. The public matches are not so nice but stick with them. I have found that if you just make sure you are a team player and watch each others back or attack together that you will most likely survive a public match. You may not win, but you won't get booted either.

												Left for Dead 2 is an amazing game. With a team of friends or future friends when you do really well the game truly shines. The achievements keep the game interesting. The introduction of special zombies and map design are in a league of their own. The character design is awesome and you truly get a feel for the team as a whole and relate to the situation and their faults and feelings through a great script and voice acting.Versus mode is well done and you get some amazing teamwork happening on both sides. Surprise cluster-F#c<$ when a team pulls off a great combo keep the game fresh on every play through.Achievements are worth chasing and give a real sense of achievement. Map design is awesome. Can't recommend this enough. If you like or want to get into a Co-op shooter then this is up there as one of the best.Last but not least who doesn't love zombies/infected?

content:
Posted: December 27, 2013
												First of all: this game is the best Cooperative FPS game you will ever find anywhere. No doubt. But before you actually decide to buy it, you must ask yourself whether you are going to play with random players or a bunch of friends. Make sure to think it through and answer honestly, it's extremely important.Should you decide to play together with your friends: BUY IT! You won't be disappointed in the slightest. This game offers an action packed gameplay, where you try your best to survive the campaign, while tricky and malignant A.I. Director will own you big time.Spawning tank where you least expect it, spawning Jockey to ra*e you should you wander off alone etc. You will find yourself in desperate situations many times, being surrounded by a horde of zombies without ammo, when slightest error means death. You should especially aim for Expert (or Expert Realism) difficulty whenever you feel ready. This way you will go through the truest L4D2 experience. You need reflex, aiming skills, a will to survive and an abillity to make decisions in a fraction of second. But your friends will certainly be there for you. They will share their medications with you, provide a cover with firearm, watch your back or... put a bullet in your back. Friendly fire is certainly here, it's quite an art not to shoot anyone with people running in panic or just changing their position. Crouch a lot so others can shoot above your head and watch your fire. Friendly fire can be even more harmful than few hits from a common infected. If you are not a maniac who loves realism in video games and just look for action packed gameplay with cooperative apporach, there is NO better option than L4D2. Do not play with bots though, they obviously can't handle more than normal difficulty level.Should you decide to play without your friends and just join random players: DO NOT BUY IT!You will fall into despair after playing a round in let's say 80% of lobbies. There will be rookies playing on expert difficulty, people who's never heard of English language and simply can't communicate with you, griefers, people who join the game just to kill you all and then leave, people who waste medications just so you won't have them, those who will incapacitate you numerous time cuz "you shouldn't get hit, I was aiming above you", those who will nonchalantly run into your fireline getting incapacitated and telling you to watch your fire etc. VS mode? Ok but you need to understand one very important aspect of it. People will leave immediately when they think they are losing the match and I'm not even joking. You owned the whole opposing team right after start? Well you can be proud, but they will leave the game and the match will end unless someone from your team joins the other one. Best advice would be: show your skills of course but give your enemies at least an impression that they can still win should they try harder. Sounds surreal but you should keep that in mind unless you want your matches to end halfway through.TL;DR: 9.5/10 for the actual game. 0/10 for community. Do not play with randoms, play with your friends.

number of helpful: 6 of 7 people (86%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 15, 2015
-Quick Review-Left 4 Dead 2 (L4D2) is a zombie/horror First Person Shooter, Left 4 Dead 2 was released in 2009 by Valve. There are thirteen campaigns in Left 4 Dead 2, Six of them are from the original Left 4 Dead Series and have the original survivors/characters.-Detailed breakdown review-Story:  Left 4 Dead 2 takes place on the top of a hotel building to the site of a Helicopter flying away and the survivors cursing their luck at missing their ticket out of this town. You play as one of four survivors: Coach, Ellis, Nick, and Rochelle.Without giving away any details on what are within the campaign, the names of the campaigns in L4D2 are: Dead Center, The Passing, Dark Carnival, Swamp Fever, Hard Rain, and the Parish. +3 downloadable campaigns. Each Campaign has its own dark theme, and sometimes it's very own zombies.Summary: You've survived the zombie apocalypse, oh no! Just kidding! Now you need to fight your way through the hoards of zombies to survive the zombie apocalypse! Fight through the city, demented circus, swamps, and tall grass fields!Game Play: Left 4 Dead 2 controls like any other FPS with the addition of flashlights, and various other weapons you can swap in-game that you find on the ground. The game lets you chose between 20+ guns and 11 melee weapons. There are a number of game modes in Left 4 Dead 2: Campaign, Single Player, Survival, Versus, Realism Versus, Realism, Scavenge, and Mutation. It's difficult to try to explain general concepts behind each game mode, each one has its own quirks or game play, generally there are two types of game modes: Story related, and Player vs Player.Achievements: Left 4 Dead 2 has 70 Achievements, at the time that I'm writing this review (05/15/15) I have 40 of these achievements... most of which are related to the main campaign. The achievements are split between the campaigns and the extra game modes where you need to play against other players.Price: Left 4 Dead 2 is priced at $19.99 for most people this is a very good deal because of the games replay value, and many features, modes, and campaigns. As always, I suggest waiting for a sale, but this is one of the first steam games I ever purchased......Mostly because of the promise of a friend who'd play it with me, and then played it with me once. Thanks, feeling the love. (I don't buy the games he recommends anymore, unless I plan to play by myself. </3  )Conclusion: In my opinion, Left 4 Dead 2 is one of the best zombie games out there. Giving you a large amount of wiggle room to use your favorite weapons regardless of how good they are, different difficulties, and competitive online play if-you-so-desire.I recommend this game to FPS Junkies, regular steam gamer's, and zombie-game-fanatics.

number of helpful: 6 of 7 people (86%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 28, 2014
												I would rate this game a 10/10, for it has no co-op zombie game superior.A fantastic game, even in this day and age years after it's original release. The game is strongly being kept alive by various active server communities as well as by the modders and mappers (of which I am one). The community as a whole is rather pass or fail though, in Pub (Public) games you will find all kinds of people, phenominally trolls, team killers, trash talkers, and bad sportsmen; these people alone are the main flaw in what is otherwise a fantastic zombie killing game. This game is easily modded and mapped for, server maintenance is easier than other games like garrysmod (for example) and when you do find friends or friendly people you will have a great time.The gore is 10/10 make sure to set it to HIGH for the full zombie killing effect, blast parts off of those zombies like no tomorrow.The sounds are 10/10, game is well made and the sounds are very definitive, you can use them to identify an infected and where they are.The environments are 10/10, they simply are aesthetically pleasing without being overwhelming.The stock (vanilla) maps (world levels) are numerous and diverse, anything from hospitals to sewers to shopping malls and national forests.The gamemodes are great 10/10:Survival (survive on a clock in a map and go for the gold in increasingly difficult hordes)Mutation (play gamemodes that change the fundaments of the game in unique ways)SingleplayerCo-op (up to 4 people on a stock server)VersusRealism Co-Op (harder co-op, no glows, witches insta kill, etc.)Realism VS (versus with no glows and witches insta kill, etc.)Scavenge (play against the infected and fill up the generator, the more cans the more points)-----The only con is the players you will find, as I said above you will meet the worst of the worst. While hackers are sparse, trolls are not.BUTdont let that discourage you because I have met hundreds of people in L4D2 that I call "Friend" and I have found many communities I can call "Home"

												Great game, lots of different game modes like survival, which is similar to black ops zombies, versus, where you play as either a zombie or a survivor, scavenge, where you find cans of gas to fill up a car while fighting away zombies and the best is the campaign, all the levels are really nicely designed and is very fun to play with friends. The workshop is also a great bonus, meaning you can have mods such  custom sound effects, zombies, weapons and custom campaigns and maps. A mod I recommend is the split screen mod, just plug in two controllers and you can play with a friend on one pc. Price drops to less than £4 on sales so can be very good value for money. Would definitley recommend,

Posted: August 13, 2015
												Note: For some reason my play hours for this and the first are waaay lower than they should be.When I heard that there would be a sequel to Left 4 Dead within a year of the original my first thought was, "Can... can Valve do that? I didn't think they were allowed to do that."My second thought was, "How could they possibly make major improvements that couldn't just be new maps?" I was so wrong to ever doubt the Great and Powerful Oz that is Valve.A female zombie, very forward thinking Valve. She's called the Spitter? One step forward, two steps back.New guns? Awesome. Smash a zombie with a guitar? What guns?New characters that still follow basic stereotypes? Who cares? I don't even remember the names from the first one.They've got new maps, new playmodes, tons of new achievements, and even more replayability. I apologize for ever doubting Valve... but you've proven you can get a sequel out quick and great, soooooooooo...Yeah, never mind. I'm happy with what we've got. I'll keep bashing in skulls with this guitar.Suggestion: Pull a Guitar Hero and add the Bass Guitar into the next game and pretend it's completely different.10/10 would completely deny having startled the witch again

content:
Posted: February 23, 2015
												This game promotes highly on teamplays, assisting others as well as communicating with your fellow teammates.There are 2 roles that you can play in this game:* As a human survivor *You will spend just as much time protecting, helping and healing your teammates as the difficulty progresses. Everything from sharing resources to pulling them up off of a ledge. Leaving a teammate behind decreases your chances of survival and running off on your own almost always ends tragically. Hence, you will come to realise that it is fun sticking together and helping one another.  **As a special infected (e.g. Smoker, Boomer, Charger, Jockey, Tank, etc...) [Only in versus mode] **Similar plays are executed from a different perspective. Only when the team that plans and works together as a whole will prevent the survivors from progressing the stage and winning. Attacking alone rarely has much of an effect since you'll get focused as soon as you are spotted, but there are a few opportunities  that allows zombie heroics (like the coveted death charge).This game offers many competitive modes with different difficulty levels of your choice. It also brings teamplay to a whole new level as you challenge higher difficulty as you progress. Worth a shot if you like zombie games! Recommended.

content:
Posted: February 19, 2014
Cooperative FPS with Zombies! [KAMGUSTA's REVIEW]You and 3 people have to find your own way to safety by killing THOUSANDS of zombies. These can be "special", with abilities that can immobilize a player or so powerful that can defeat all 4 players by themselves, so you have to listen to every sound and keep your eyes always open. There are dozens of weapons that gets upgraded by the time, but you will soon notice that your best chance of surviving is by helping each other (and the game greatly forces you to do this)!Game is divided in "campaigns", each one can be completed in 1-2 hours and has different levels of difficulty. The single player story is nice (but don't expect speeches or cinematics: this game has only action) but the game really shines online: it still has dedicated (and populated) servers and it's very easy to join a game. You can play the official campaigns (they also remade the ones from LFD1), custom ones or some nice variations on the gameplay like humans vs zombies.Replay value is high: you will spend countless hours without noticing! And killing lot of zombies in easy mode is a great stress relief!There is really nothing more you can ask, if not another Left for Dead.Best played with Keyboard and MouseRecommended Buy Price < 30$Score 9/10

number of helpful: 6 of 7 people (86%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 24, 2014
												Gameplay controls are easy to learn and master. Modding the game, downloading new maps, skins, or different game modes is very easy due to Steam Community Workshop. If some aspect of the game becomes dull and unintriguing, you can always find new content on the Steam Workshop.It's fun at first, but over time it starts lacking the same experience as in the beginning if you keep paying the same game modes.  The community isn't the greatest either when it comes to newer players. You automatically receive a nasty comment when you make a mistake. Game would be more fun if other players weren't as discouraging. But, not all players are bad and rude, there are some players that help you out and teach you other things that you might've not already known.I'm putting this review as recommended but my thoughts about this game are mixed and I'd recommend on some aspects but not on other ones. The biggest downside to this game, I think, is the childish Community, but if you're up for it and don't really care about that, it would be a fun game. On the otherhand, if you dislike childish Communities, don't buy this game unless you're going to play with close friends that don't mind you sucking at first or completely carrying the team depending how good you are.

												Продолжение одного из лучшего кооперативного зомби-шутера! Новые главные горои, новая сюжетная линия. number of helpful: 7 of 9 people (78%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 30, 2015
												Once again Valve set the standard for game development! L4D2 is, on the surface, a simple game based upon easy to understand principles and mechanics... however it is a game of outstanding depth and complexity that takes many 1000s of hours play to master. Recomendations for new players. 1) Learn the game in easy/normal coop mode before moving on to higher levels and competitive modes. 2) Try to make friends with players who are of a similar level as yourself, there is no matchmaking in L4D2 but you will have a far more enjoyable time playing with players like yourself. 3) L4D2 is a TEAM game, if you join a random game your actions could very dramatically effect the progression of the game for the other players, a game that may have been going on for a long time before your arrival. Show respect for other players, if you just want to mess about please don't ruin other peoples games at the same time, this is not TF2 or CS casual where you can jump in and out of games without having any effect on other people playing the game. If you are a solo gamer, who always likes doing their own thing, who plays alone and doenst want to think about or worry about other players, then L4D2 is NOT RECOMMENDED FOR YOU!

content:
Posted: March 23, 2016
												Left 4 Dead 2 wasn't the kind of game I thought it would be. I suppose I was expecting something along the lines of Dead Island, or Dead Rising, but Left 4 Dead 2 is far from that. It is a survival game, where you rush to get through various area's, collect weapons and healing kits and more, as you fight waves of incoming, increasingly deadly zombies. Some are spitters, some are chargers, almost all of them run directly for you, full sprint, and you must push through to stay alive. Now there are several different ways to play this. I chose a single player game where I was given a team of NPC's to accompany me; However, the campaign mode is a cooperative multiplayer mode, where you play with other players online.  I'm not really a fan of cooperative or competitive multiplayer, so I'm glad Left 4 Dead 2 allowed me to play solo, but there are several other modes available, as well as addon content and more. It's not a bad game, it was actually kind of fun, although I thought it could have been more difficult on the hardest settings. over 130 of my friends have this game so obviously people like it, after playing it for a short time, I can see why.

content:
Posted: November 24, 2016
												(Review only about the campaign mode since i don't play Versus which also a very good and still played mode).Still one of the best PvE Co-Op games. L4D2 took the formula (and the content) from L4D1 and polished it with a few more special infected and weapons, balancing gameplay to an almost perfect point. Special infected force you to play together with your team and cover each other, while hordes and events keep the adrenaline going. Maps are very well designed and paced, especially the ones from L4D1 which were officially ported to L4D2.The game has a few anoying bugs, especially regarding common infected movement but other than that it's a great game than even today can be addictive, especialy since no other title has managed to improve upon L4D2.It's also one of the few games in recent history that supports mods. All the cosmetic microtansactions you pay for on other games are available here as free mods, which opens the doors to having a completely revamped arsenal, characters, textures and game experience.

number of helpful: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 11, 2016
												This review is long overdue.One word: Zoey. Man, she is so purdy. OK that was more than one word.Some more words: this game is probably the awesomest co-op I have ever played. And it holds up very well after more than six years. The basic idea is very simple. Four survivors depart from a safe room, slog their way through level after level of regular and "special" zombies and reach the next safe room. Do that a few times and after the finale you get rescued by helicopter. If you're lucky that is, and most of the time you're not.Since the levels and characters of the original Left 4 Dead (including Zoey) got ported into L4D2, this game is all you need to fulfill your zombie slaughtering desires. The original levels of the first game are there, and a bunch of new levels. And if you ever get bored of the campaign, you can play Versus mode and BE the "special" zombie. If you do it properly you get to barf on people. Now how cool is that! Or maybe you can jump from a building and land on top of Zoey and just "tear" into her. But no I could never do that.But the two sets of four survivors from the two games live in separate universes, right? Wrong! They meet, and Ellis declares his everlasting love for Zoey (but is conflicted if he wants to marry her or not, after seeing the bride witch). Now in any decently run fanboy/fangirl universe, the two stick together, live through the end of the apocalypse, settle down and have a bunch of babies. But now I am getting into pathetic levels of fantasies about fictional characters.So to make a long story short. Terrific campaigns with two sets of four survivors. A "be the zombie" mode called Versus, Steam Workshop with tons of things you can use to add flavor to the game, and of course Zoey to remind us all that girls are just as badass as boys. Though I will never understand why they added Max Payne as a character with a white suit who always complains about anything Ellis does. If you don't own this, what are you doing on Steam?Summarized in one word: Zoey!

content:
Posted: November 10, 2014
												Almost every gamer loves zombie games, L4D2 has the 2nd best story i've experienced (Behind Resident Evil 4) and very colourful characters. Multiplayer is awesome especially with friends you know personally (Or on steam) It's very simple to play so noobs can pick it up easily but takes time to master, it really gives the player that "It feels good to help and work together" sensationThe good:Decent storyline and loveable charactersGraphics are pretty goodGameplay is easy to pick up quickly though sometimes "graphic bugged" (Actually rigged in favor of bad players)Can be exhilerating to play with friends and help each other surviveA great game for the extroverted type of playerNever the exact same zombie and item spawn locations twice giving the player the unpredicable feeling and great for lifespanThe bad:Trolls on multiplayer that incap you with autoshotties and molotovs when you're trying those expert achievementsRigged in multiplayer in favor of new/bad players so they don't quit playing (Charging through players, "glitched" hunter pounces, the AI director spawing less hordes for them, Aimbots that help them get headshots)Bots can be absolute dumb-f*cks since it is a game that plays by the situation and not by the book (Bots ALWAYS play by the book)Mutation mode and single player mode should be more one player friendly and much more beatableSomehow keep ending up playing with noobs all the time or kicked for the most minute reasonsDefinately not a game for loners or hermits as its heavily team-coordinatedModded multiplayer campaigns and VS games can make it extremely unfair in favor of the player(s) hosting itOverall I reccommend it but give it time before you play certain modes and always expect the bad so they'll be no shock or nasty surprises

content:
Posted: July 31, 2015
												Overall I think this game is fantastic, the concept and the gameplay are great and with the amount of mods, campaigns, and other addons you can get on the Workshop it truly never gets old or tiring, as long as you're playing the Left 4 Dead 1 portions. The Left 4 Dead 2 characters are very uninteresting, it hardly ever goes into any of their backstories, unlike the Left 4 Dead 1 characters where your hear Bill telling all these stories about Vietnam or Louis about his office. Not only does it not go into their background, the characters don't match their supposed backgrounds either. Coach was supposedly a health teacher, he never talks about it in-game, and I doubt a health teacher would go on and on about how much they love cotton candy, pizza, and cheeseburgers. The Left 4 Dead 2 campaigns themselves, while creative (with the exception of Dead Center) do not have the same amount of replayability as the original's either. Both Dead Center and The Parish are mainly just walking through the streets, Hard Rain you literally go through the same place twice, Swamp Fever's scenery gets pretty boring pretty fast. Dark Carnival is the only campaign I think even comes close to Left 4 Dead 1. None of the Left 4 Dead 2 campaigns are good for Versus either. There aren't many setup spots for the infected, there are hardly any decent rooftops for Smokers to grab Survivors from or for Hunters to jump off, and there is way too much open space for Boomers to be effective. You can tell they really focused the campaigns around the Charger, Spitter, and Jockey. With all the narrow alleys and kill areas near many major sections of the game, it's really paradise for them.While this game definitely does have it strong suits, particularly with the workshop and the new infected, it honestly seems unnecessary. The original game was better than it in almost every way. I only continue to play it because of the mods I have and because it contains the original campaigns. Which is why I do recommend this over the original. It has Left 4 Dead 1's campaigns and characters with some new weapons and infected thrown in. I just suggest staying away from the Left 4 Dead 2 parts.

content:
Posted: March 29, 2015
Rank:	7.5/10Recommendation(s):	Play Left 4 Dead 1 first.Major Theme:	Your zombie action movie that you get to be a part of.Bought at Price:	Valve Complete PackValve and multiplayer games. Well, they go together very well. Not sure what really else you want to know.The game mechanics work great, the game has workshop support; it is also well taken care of by Valve and the community.If you have a chance, listen to the developer commentary. It will give you a real look inside the games Valve makes.Most people who have things bad to say about the game say things like: This stuff should have been in Left 4 Dead 1. There's limited maps. Why isn't there this ridiculous zombie type X, Y, ZAnswering those problems… Yes, I'm aware of the controversy around the splitting of games. I know I wouldn't have liked it, but I bought the complete pack after this happened, and long before TF2 became free2play. For me, the split seems to make logical sense. Left 4 Dead 1 was a harder game partly due to the fact of the limited weapons. Left 4 Dead 2 opened the doors on this and added a variety of things. While you can play Left 4 Dead 1 maps in the 2nd game, I still feel the need to play it on the original game, with the original mechanics.Limited maps.. Well it does follow a story, and the maps use a AI director in the background to make changes to maps. In the core, there are about 3 or 4 (if I remember correctly) base maps for each part of a campaign that get used. The director makes changes to spawns and what not on the fly. You probably won't be playing thousands of hours on this title, but expect a good return for your money.Zombie types… This is a big thing with some people. The root of this issue is that there aren’t any binding specs to "zombies". Does the mutation/virus/disease effect people, humans, animals? If so, what can happen to each?Valve tries to make the game reasonable, and the mechanics show that. They are well balanced, and don’t require hundreds of hours to perfect.

Rank:	7.5/10Recommendation(s):	Play Left 4 Dead 1 first.Major Theme:	Your zombie action movie that you get to be a part of.Bought at Price:	Valve Complete PackValve and multiplayer games. Well, they go together very well. Not sure what really else you want to know.The game mechanics work great, the game has workshop support; it is also well taken care of by Valve and the community.If you have a chance, listen to the developer commentary. It will give you a real look inside the games Valve makes.Most people who have things bad to say about the game say things like: This stuff should have been in Left 4 Dead 1. There's limited maps. Why isn't there this ridiculous zombie type X, Y, ZAnswering those problems… Yes, I'm aware of the controversy around the splitting of games. I know I wouldn't have liked it, but I bought the complete pack after this happened, and long before TF2 became free2play. For me, the split seems to make logical sense. Left 4 Dead 1 was a harder game partly due to the fact of the limited weapons. Left 4 Dead 2 opened the doors on this and added a variety of things. While you can play Left 4 Dead 1 maps in the 2nd game, I still feel the need to play it on the original game, with the original mechanics.Limited maps.. Well it does follow a story, and the maps use a AI director in the background to make changes to maps. In the core, there are about 3 or 4 (if I remember correctly) base maps for each part of a campaign that get used. The director makes changes to spawns and what not on the fly. You probably won't be playing thousands of hours on this title, but expect a good return for your money.Zombie types… This is a big thing with some people. The root of this issue is that there aren’t any binding specs to "zombies". Does the mutation/virus/disease effect people, humans, animals? If so, what can happen to each?Valve tries to make the game reasonable, and the mechanics show that. They are well balanced, and don’t require hundreds of hours to perfect.

content:
Posted: April 9, 2014
												This is in my opinion a good game.It has relatively good content for value, including content from the previous game, making it a good standalone, while it can be slightly confusing at times, and for high level co-operative multiplayer a mic might be needed to maintain the constant, the versus mode is very enjoyable, as is most of the multiplayer and singleplayer content.Sometimes it has a steep learning curve and other times it's a breeze. Im no professional by any standards at FPS, but i breezed through the first level on singleplayer, i even cleared the whole place out of common infected. Skip forward 1 or two more games and i was with my bot team being charged off a three story walkway in 'Dead Centre' (Mall themed map) instantly losing. That's just how it goes.If you by any chance have it within your steam library from the christmas giveaway  for activation or are considering to buy it, then do so and have fun, even if you are complete beginner.

content:
Posted: November 10, 2014
												Almost every gamer loves zombie games, L4D2 has the 2nd best story i've experienced (Behind Resident Evil 4) and very colourful characters. Multiplayer is awesome especially with friends you know personally (Or on steam) It's very simple to play so noobs can pick it up easily but takes time to master, it really gives the player that "It feels good to help and work together" sensationThe good:Decent storyline and loveable charactersGraphics are pretty goodGameplay is easy to pick up quickly though sometimes "graphic bugged" (Actually rigged in favor of bad players)Can be exhilerating to play with friends and help each other surviveA great game for the extroverted type of playerNever the exact same zombie and item spawn locations twice giving the player the unpredicable feeling and great for lifespanThe bad:Trolls on multiplayer that incap you with autoshotties and molotovs when you're trying those expert achievementsRigged in multiplayer in favor of new/bad players so they don't quit playing (Charging through players, "glitched" hunter pounces, the AI director spawing less hordes for them, Aimbots that help them get headshots)Bots can be absolute dumb-f*cks since it is a game that plays by the situation and not by the book (Bots ALWAYS play by the book)Mutation mode and single player mode should be more one player friendly and much more beatableSomehow keep ending up playing with noobs all the time or kicked for the most minute reasonsDefinately not a game for loners or hermits as its heavily team-coordinatedModded multiplayer campaigns and VS games can make it extremely unfair in favor of the player(s) hosting itOverall I reccommend it but give it time before you play certain modes and always expect the bad so they'll be no shock or nasty surprises

number of helpful: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 11, 2016
												This review is long overdue.One word: Zoey. Man, she is so purdy. OK that was more than one word.Some more words: this game is probably the awesomest co-op I have ever played. And it holds up very well after more than six years. The basic idea is very simple. Four survivors depart from a safe room, slog their way through level after level of regular and "special" zombies and reach the next safe room. Do that a few times and after the finale you get rescued by helicopter. If you're lucky that is, and most of the time you're not.Since the levels and characters of the original Left 4 Dead (including Zoey) got ported into L4D2, this game is all you need to fulfill your zombie slaughtering desires. The original levels of the first game are there, and a bunch of new levels. And if you ever get bored of the campaign, you can play Versus mode and BE the "special" zombie. If you do it properly you get to barf on people. Now how cool is that! Or maybe you can jump from a building and land on top of Zoey and just "tear" into her. But no I could never do that.But the two sets of four survivors from the two games live in separate universes, right? Wrong! They meet, and Ellis declares his everlasting love for Zoey (but is conflicted if he wants to marry her or not, after seeing the bride witch). Now in any decently run fanboy/fangirl universe, the two stick together, live through the end of the apocalypse, settle down and have a bunch of babies. But now I am getting into pathetic levels of fantasies about fictional characters.So to make a long story short. Terrific campaigns with two sets of four survivors. A "be the zombie" mode called Versus, Steam Workshop with tons of things you can use to add flavor to the game, and of course Zoey to remind us all that girls are just as badass as boys. Though I will never understand why they added Max Payne as a character with a white suit who always complains about anything Ellis does. If you don't own this, what are you doing on Steam?Summarized in one word: Zoey!

												Still love this game several years after it came out. Features include 1 man cheeseburger apocalypse, interesting asymetric pvp multiplayer modes (Dev studio seems to have built a whole game on this concept which is coming this year hopefully called Evolve).One other major plus is the Steam workshop intergration, you can get hundreds of mods for the game, maps, new characters, new guns etc all by simply clicking, no external sites no dodgy how do i install, all done for you. I wish more developers would do this.

												Left 4 Dead 2 is a movie-like video game that was released in the fall of 2009. It is a game that requires esential teamwork and thinking. You are able to play as four charcters. (Rochelle, Coach, Nick, and Ellis)The main objective of the game is to escape an enormous horde of the undead. (Zombies)There are also seven special type of enemies--Which are the Charger, Jockey, Hunter, Witch, Spitter, Boomer and Tank. This game is very incredible and realistic. I reccomend it for every gamer and horror fanatic.

number of helpful: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 24, 2014
												Left 4 Dead 2 will always be a classic game to play, especially being a sequel to a game that was too, amazing. The introductions from the first game, such as new Special Infected, new weapons and campaigns makes this game a must buy to any gamer. The campaign has the standard maps, which in turn are great, but best played with friends, as the AI are dull in the sense to play with, as they will basically do most of the shooting for you. The Multiplayer aspect to the game, such as Versus will always have people playing and there are plently of servers to play with. A warning though, Versus does get extremly competitive at times and you will want to die inside if you are losing.Pros:- Improved from the original Left 4 Dead- Extremly balanced gameplay- Great level design - Guns and Special Infected improved- Fun for everyone. Single player is fun, Campaign with friends is fun and Multiplayer is fun.Cons:- If you don't have friends then the game can be boring. - AI on singleplayer will do everything for you. (Can be seen as a good thing, but not entirely)- Hard Rain will make you want to cry and die inside. (Like the witches)- Left 4 Dead was known for being dark and more tense with gameplay, which is completly lacking in Left 4 Dead 2. Only in a few areas is there darkness, but instead you walk down streets completly bright. Only in a minority of maps, such as the swamp maps and when it rains is there any kind of fear. Overall, the game is a must buy for everyone. Now that is has been a few years, I do suggest only getting it when it is on sale. Playing the game just for the campaign will get you a few hours played, but if you do get into the versus and the competitive game modes, you will be guarenteed a ton of hours played.

number of helpful: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 23, 2016
												Tactical fps co-op game where mostly everything will revolve around your team strenght and power to overcome sometimes impossible obstacles and get to the safe room.This game will offer you tons and tons of fun. It features a variety of new special infected like the Charger, and you will learn to hate each and every one of them. Every campaign from the 1st game is here and remastered, some of the map layouts are changed to provide a bigger challenge. Few new game modes like realism expert, realism versus, scavenge and mutation mods.New weapon types, addition of melee weapons, finally you can replace those pesky pistols with a katana, or a frying pan, baseball bat, you name it. Guns such as desert eagle, scar, spas shotgun and many more. Quite a lot of achievements too, now listen, if you're a perfectionist, and you want all the achievements in the game, you're out of luck. There's a certain achievement here impossible to achieve without using a 3rd party software.Better and more improved AI. AI in the 1st game was mediocre at best, while in this game, though bots are still dumb, they will stick around you and not wander around the map or get stuck. One of the things that makes these bots dumb is their inabillity of picking up gas cans, which you'll find to be necessary on some parts of the game. It will still take them forever to find you and free you from a special infected.Special infected AI is back and is much more ruthless, remember those bulls*it spawns from the 1st game? In this game, you can literally walk, hear that horde noise, turn back around to see zombies spawning out of mid air. Most of the special infected utilize camping as a way of luring you to the right place so they can devour you. Some maps even have dynamical weather changing. Meaning at one point you can clearly see everything around you, and at the other, rain comes down to totally annihilate your line of sight. Everything thanks to the new AI Director. If you start preforming well in the game's campaign, if you think the game is easy on the highest difficulty setting. In a matter of seconds you'll find you were dead wrong. As he'll release all hell to come down on you and your team.Now, let's talk about the community. People that play campaigns generally consist of 3 categories. Noobs, vets and griefers. Noobs being the people on any difficulty doing some stupid mistakes you would not believe are possible, like shoving a tank. Vets would be generally nice people helping everyone to beat the campaign or leaving no one behind, or be the exact opposite(rushers). And griefers, like in the 1st game, where this form of cancer is present but fading as the 1st game is dying, in this game, there's a lot more of them, from people that join your game just to kill themselves, to people killing your entire team at the end of a finale. So, be careful, when you encounter one of those, block them, or play with friends only.Versus community on the other hand holds the saltiest and most poisonous types of people. They expect nothing but perfection from you and even when you're the best player on your team you will still get kicked because you stepped onto someone's nerves. Or you're just too good. On most servers admins will be id*ots and will boot you if you make one mistake. So, do not approach the versus community unless you're fully certain of your capabilities, and if you can handle yourself when thrown into the belly of a shark.7 years old game still getting updates and who's community is still strong ranging at, at least 3k-5k people playing daily.This game is awesome, challenging, perflectly blended the action and the suspense. Excellent soundtrack, but it took a lighter tone than the 1st game. Anyhow, I'd give this game 9/10. Love it with all my heart. All the fun moments it brought me and all the great people I met in it. Recommended all the way.

content:
Posted: March 31, 2014
												Hi there Many of you gamers out there well probably most of you probably have Left4dead2 I have played this game quite a bit and i think it is one of the best smaller first person shooters around. I refered to this as a smaller FPS because there are many bigger titles eg. the Battlefeild and Call of Duty Franchise but this isnt about them now it is it!!. swiftly moving on the control mechanics are quite smooth and easy to learn and get used to if you are new to L4D2. the enemys in this game are a wide array of charecters from a Slow, exploding charecter called a Boomer that attracts other enimies to where ever you are on the map. another Enemy is a fast moving charecter called a charger which does generally what the name suggests runs and charges at you. The maps that are in this game are wide open... most of the time, but sometimes are in really tight spaces for example in the map Dead Centre but ill let you figure it out. the weapons are just the average guns you would expect e.g shotguns and sniper rifles but there are weapons with a twist e.g bile bombs have fun with them. over all i really enjoy this game and i highly recommend this game to everyone. Ps. im spoiling the campaign so have fun :)I rate this game 10/10Thanks for ya time.

number of helpful: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 24, 2014
												Left 4 Dead 2 will always be a classic game to play, especially being a sequel to a game that was too, amazing. The introductions from the first game, such as new Special Infected, new weapons and campaigns makes this game a must buy to any gamer. The campaign has the standard maps, which in turn are great, but best played with friends, as the AI are dull in the sense to play with, as they will basically do most of the shooting for you. The Multiplayer aspect to the game, such as Versus will always have people playing and there are plently of servers to play with. A warning though, Versus does get extremly competitive at times and you will want to die inside if you are losing.Pros:- Improved from the original Left 4 Dead- Extremly balanced gameplay- Great level design - Guns and Special Infected improved- Fun for everyone. Single player is fun, Campaign with friends is fun and Multiplayer is fun.Cons:- If you don't have friends then the game can be boring. - AI on singleplayer will do everything for you. (Can be seen as a good thing, but not entirely)- Hard Rain will make you want to cry and die inside. (Like the witches)- Left 4 Dead was known for being dark and more tense with gameplay, which is completly lacking in Left 4 Dead 2. Only in a few areas is there darkness, but instead you walk down streets completly bright. Only in a minority of maps, such as the swamp maps and when it rains is there any kind of fear. Overall, the game is a must buy for everyone. Now that is has been a few years, I do suggest only getting it when it is on sale. Playing the game just for the campaign will get you a few hours played, but if you do get into the versus and the competitive game modes, you will be guarenteed a ton of hours played.

content:
Posted: September 17, 2012
Timeless Zombie ClassicPlug zombies, troll your friends, PVP, or coordinate your badassery. Laughs (or tears) will be had and the community-made mods available can really enhance your game experience. This game easily makes Top 10 Best Co-Op games. Even though it's almost been a decade since it's release, the themes, mechanics, and art direction still hold up to today's standards. Sadly, some of the hilarious game mode servers are no longer active but the vanilla servers can still tide you over into the next generation of gaming.I strongly recommend playing this with friends; pugging is always a mixed bag that I'm no longer a fan of. You'll either have speedrunners, trolls, serious players, FPS newbies, complete jerks, and/or casual players. I've made a lot of memories, good friends, and strengthened friendships playing this game. There's a large selection of game modes and maps to play on, from the campaign to the Versus mode where you get to be a Special zombie. Unfortunately, there is significantly less people playing nowadays but you can still get matched with pugs and/or play with friends.You're not a real zombie fan until you have this title in your library.10/10 - JUNEBUG'S FAVORITES

content:
Posted: November 15, 2014
												Unlike most other shooters, Left 4 Dead hinges on cooperative multiplayer. You and three friends must shoot, tear and slash through an unrelenting mass of raging zombies. From the moment you leave the safe house to the final rescue chopper, you are completely dependent on each other and constantly hunted by special boss zombies that behave with their own aggressive, strategizing intelligence. Thanks to Valve’s omniscient “AI Director,” the zombies spawn differently every time, the special infected try alternative attacks, and even weapon drops are changed based on your performance. This makes every single playthrough slightly different, and the resultant strategy to survive much more organic and integral than any other FPS on the market. Just like Street Fighter is much more than mashing on buttons, Left 4 Dead is far more than mindless shooting. Played properly, L4D offers 100+ hours of unrivaled co-op insanity.

number of helpful: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 27, 2014
												This is an interesting one, as I play this almost daily with friends, so biases are everywhere.I'd really recommend you buy this game with a four pack and play with friends, as trying to find decent lobbies online is a nightmare, what with the toxic and unforgiving community. Try to avoid playing online with randoms.That being said, playing this with friends is one of the best experiences I've had on PC. A great thing about it is it's abundance of things to do. You have thirteen campaigns right out of the gate, each being quite varied.When you're bored of those, knock the difficulty up to expert and start playing the game seriously while you get instantly incapped by the tank and figure out how to allocate health supplies.When you're bored of that, get four more friends and pit each other against one another in versus, as you try to complete the campaign with others controlling the zombies. Once you're dead, the sides swap and you control the zombies. You can play this on all campaigns.When you're bored of that, you can play scavenge mode. Scavenge is a unique mode similar to versus, but the objective as survivors is to fill up a generator with gas cans scattered across an area. Your opposition is four human-controlled special infected, much like versus. You can only do this on select maps.When you're bored of that, try survival mode. It is exactly what it sounds like: hold out against the infected until you die.When you're bored of that, try the mutations. Mutations are alternate game modes that are variants of the average campaign, scavenge, versus, and survival modes. They will definitely revive your interest in the game.When you're bored of that, start looking at mods and downloadable maps and modes. The good side of the community makes great addons, maps and modes that will blow my mind (After 200 plus hours, I was blown away by some of the modes and maps) And when you're bored of that, the stuff you started out doing will be somehow fun again.Maybe you won't get 200+ hours like I have, or even 100 hours, but I find it hard to believe that a group of friends will not at least for some time, enjoy this game.Rating: ★★★★★ Highly recommended

content:
Posted: February 8
												One of my all-time favorite games, I've spent about 650+ hours in total playing it.If you like the game, the following reasons will probably keep you entertained like me for a long time:My pros:+ well-balanced game mechanics+ great design (graphics, textures, characters and zombies)+ CPU-friendly+ randomly generated action which makes every game mostly unique+ various gamemodes+ endless workshop modification possibilites (soundmods, custom maps, gamemodes, scripts, textures/models and much more)+ basically contains the predecessor Left 4 Dead+ interesting weapons+ useful delevoper console for examining and adjusting your gameMy cons:- it's not easy to find enjoyable public online games (because of trolls, unfriendly people and bad matchmaking algorithms) if you don't have many steam-friends to play with privatly- addons will sometimes clash and make your game crash without a warning, so you have to go through trial and error to find and solve the problem- some game mechanics are a bit glitchy (hitboxes and sounds)- the bots are an impressive accomplishment for the game programmers, but you should rather play without bots if you can since they still are pretty useless in most complex situationsMy rating:9.5 out of 10

content:
Posted: October 4, 2014
												Whether players enjoy this game depends on their method of approach towards it. Campaign: On lower difficulties, 8 year olds, rambos and headless chickens get to blast their way through every map unscathed... meh. Decision making skills best tested on Realism Expert, Versus, Realism Versus and / or Scavenge modes where tactical mistakes and friendly fire made by one member can easily punish the remaining 3. That the AI Director creates social experiments out of difficult situations makes every game play dynamic. Definitely one of my all-time favourites.

												This game is a really good way to become unbored. Need to murder some zombies endlessly? Then this is your game!There's many different game modes like Survival, campaign, single player and even a really good idea which is 2 times 1 of zombies 1 of humans and the humans have to complete a mission of the campaign and obiously the zombies have to kill them. This game has given me many hours of enjoyment and if you do happen to get bored of the campaign or are bored of surviving then there's plenty of way to fill that and continue playing, like using the workshop, it has many downloadable items to make your characters look different, re-skin the weapons and even has completely new campaings! this game is a really fun and time wasting game, I would recommend! 9/10

number of helpful: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 18, 2015
												注意:以下内容可能引起极大部分初中未毕业的玩家极大的不适。这篇评测是我想到哪里就写到哪里的，可能这篇评测到写到最后已经脱离了主题，可能写到最后已经有评测游戏到评测别的东西。但无论最后结果如何，我都要借着这次新年的机会，给求生之路带来新年新气象的祝福的同时，吐出我心中的想法。那么开始了。——————————————————————————————————如果这款游戏仅仅有单人模式的话，我给满分。但要是可以联机，那么问题就来了。先说个题外话吧。大家对求生之路的认识是缘于何处呢？朋友的介绍？玩家的视频？其他地方的小广告？当然了，了解这款游戏的方式肯定不止以上几点，无论从您从哪里接触的这款游戏，我还是要说，如果您并不是抱着单纯的来玩这个游戏的目的的话，那么我建议您以后不要再玩，或者只玩单人模式！在这里，我想专门把看视频而了解这款游戏的玩家提出来单独说，这些玩家肯定大多数都来自于B站。至于是看了哪个UP主的视频，为了避免不必要的麻烦，我还是不说了，而这些观众的年龄段，我也不想多说了。因为我只是个普通人，既不想被挂到微博里让大家厌恶，也不想以后只能吃流食度日。Steam吧有一个人有一段话说的特别特别的对：“这个...给你个建议吧，没事去AB站，看看各位UP主最近在撸哪些游戏，然后首页哪些游戏出现频率比较高，于是乎你就知道哪些游戏最近别碰了。”仅仅是UP主们的几个视频就能引起如此大的危言来让大家耸听吗？肯定不是，那么问题就出在这些视频的受众群体上面了。在上面我已经说过，这些人的年龄段大家都懂。UP主们的视频确实给这款游戏带来了新鲜血液，但并没有彻底改善他们的素质。这些人就如同墙头草一般，哪个游戏的视频火，那就去玩哪个游戏。MC就是个典型的例子。现在的MC我基本已经不碰了，至少不会和其他人一起玩了。因为这些人实在是太恶心了！并不是因为他们不会玩，如果仅仅是不会玩那么反而还好办了，他们不是爱看视频吗，那些UP主的实力都不错，有一个甚至是以前打过比赛的选手，所以他们只需要看和听，就能掌握这款游戏的基础玩法。但他们不那么做，他们看视频只是看个热闹，玩游戏时也不过脑子，置其他队友的想法于不顾。中国玩家的素质大家都懂，我对此也很愧疚和痛心，但是我一个人的力量是不能挽救的，而且这篇评测写完之后，我人能不能好好的活着还有待考究。所以我在此只能给一条建议：如果你只是喜欢那些UP主的视频而并不是因为喜欢这款游戏才看UP主的视频的话，我建议你不要买这款游戏，不然你自己也是浪费钱，还弄的其他玩家不爽，何必呢？而且我也想给想上传自己视频的有心的玩家或者是有心的UP主一条建议：如果你真的想让这款游戏变好的话，那么请不要上传相关的视频！让这款游戏清者自清就好！所以这款游戏，单人的话，我给满分，多人的话，那就要看玩家的素质与否了。如果你是我在上面说的玩家的话，那么不要买，这是为了你好。——————————————————————————————————时隔半年，再次评测。以前的评测我不会删除。现在这游戏，高冷的，自以为是的脑残满大街都是。这游戏快完了。我坚持了半年，但我觉得我坚持不下去了。如果你觉得我遇到的脑残是个例的话，那我只能说，你遇到的正常玩家也是个例。

content:
Posted: February 4, 2015
												It's a yes/no review.From left 4 dead the orginial back in 2008, I loved how dark and complicated some of maps were. I loved the Sacrafice, and the orginal maps (not so much Crash Course though.)When Left 4 dead 2 came out, I expected the same gloominess and terror in each map, but with some of the maps, I didn't feel it. I appreciate Hard Rain, which was pretty cool. But some of the maps were not scary, or just too bright with the sunlight and what not.I liked the original dark setting, which kind of changed the way I felt about playing Left 4 dead 2.The game is good, but number one will always be my favorite.

number of helpful: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 8
												One of my all-time favorite games, I've spent about 650+ hours in total playing it.If you like the game, the following reasons will probably keep you entertained like me for a long time:My pros:+ well-balanced game mechanics+ great design (graphics, textures, characters and zombies)+ CPU-friendly+ randomly generated action which makes every game mostly unique+ various gamemodes+ endless workshop modification possibilites (soundmods, custom maps, gamemodes, scripts, textures/models and much more)+ basically contains the predecessor Left 4 Dead+ interesting weapons+ useful delevoper console for examining and adjusting your gameMy cons:- it's not easy to find enjoyable public online games (because of trolls, unfriendly people and bad matchmaking algorithms) if you don't have many steam-friends to play with privatly- addons will sometimes clash and make your game crash without a warning, so you have to go through trial and error to find and solve the problem- some game mechanics are a bit glitchy (hitboxes and sounds)- the bots are an impressive accomplishment for the game programmers, but you should rather play without bots if you can since they still are pretty useless in most complex situationsMy rating:9.5 out of 10

content:
Posted: July 31, 2014
												As if Left 4 Dead wasn't good enough, Valve had to come along and make it better. New special infected, melee weapons,  more maps, new characters, and a crazy number of game modes! Plus all the original content! So many hours of entertainment from a single game--the value is simply priceless. And never has Valve asked me to put more money up for any additional content. This is why Valve thrives and DLC hungry companies fail. Because they actually put their customer base first instead of their shareholders. They look beyond the wallet and provide a better overall experience to the consumer.

content:
Posted: February 6, 2014
												To start off, I must admit I'm a big fan of the Valve studio, simply because they will release titles that just can't seem to dissapoint. Counterstrike, Portal, Team Fortress, Half life and so on are examples of titles that just bring pleasure, and any lacks they have will be forfeit due to the low prices they offer for their titles.Left 4 Dead is no exception. They combined the lust of the player to shoot as many walking (un)dead people as they can with the ammunition they can find with simple, but nice gameplay. One of it's strong elements is the familiarity of this gameplay. I found a couple of Zombie Survival games quite complicated, which will be frustrating during the game instead of helpfull and fun to pick up.The multiplayer functions are quite the same as singleplayer (though you'll find teammates definately less helpfull when playing online), with a couple of different gamemodes (only storyline is available for offline).They also knew how to combine teamplay into this. If the other people from your team do not live up to what's expected in that difficulty, you WILL not succeed. Please note that I'm not saying this game is therefore a realistic one, it's still shooting hordes of zombies. But a little surfival is always nice next to the ''spray an burn'' of an average zombie shooter.Anyway, Left 4 Dead 2 is a great multiplayer game and definately lives up to it's predecessor Left 4 Dead. I give it a 9/10!

content:
Posted: February 1, 2014
												Left 4 Dead 2 is the return to the zombie infested streets but is it a game you will want to slash through ? Im just gonna go out loud and say it if by the time youre reading this review and havent played or own L4D2 you need to get this game right now. Left 4 dead 2 is a simple game where four Charecters Coach, Ellis, Nick and Rochelle are trying to survive the zombie apocalypse. The game is tons of fun and will almost never get boring and plus as a bonus to already 5 great campaings it also adds all the campaings from the first L4D and remasters them and plus all the dlc campaings for aboslutly free. Now like with every game it has small issues that ruin the game. The shooting mechanics arent always the best and the hit detection works when it wants to. The melee weapons are a fun way of disposing of Zombies but when it comes to melee weapons its best to choose a sharp weapon instead of a blunt one. Overall the game is awesome and you just need to own this tile with some small issues its a great time and even better with friends i give Left 4 Dead 2  9.5/10

content:
Posted: January 3, 2015
												Here is Left 4 Dead 2, the sequel of Left 4 Dead (which I have also reviewed :)" I'm gonna do it the same stuff but I'll add ratings.Atomosphere: The atomosphere in L4D2 is somewhat less gritty and horror like. It's turned into an action/adventure instead of a horror like game. Thought I'm not complaining because it's L4D, and I like them both c: 7/10Overall score: 7/10Characters: Nick- The somewhat of a second-in-command in the group, a deadpan, snarky gambler who probably isn't from the South, but out of bad luck, less or more, has ended up there because of the zombie apocalypse. He is rather attractive for a game character but I rarely, if ever play him by choice. I rate him 6/10.Coach- Coach is the most supportive member of the L4D2 crew. He seems to enjoy football, Gibby Jr. and Midnight Riders. He seems to get along with Ellis and Rochelle. He is pretty cool, don't really pay much attention to him though. I rate him 5/10.Ellis- Ellis is a "adorkable" hillbilly who has the same interests as Coach, and is a mechanic. He also plays bass guitar! Ellis has a bunch of stories about his time with his buddy Keith, usually starting with, "This one time". I rate him 10/10. He is my favorite character.Rochelle- Probably the most hated character in gaming history, or Valve games for that matter. But I think she is rather boring, but the second to most supportive character in L4D2. She is also a reporter and a fan of electronic band Depeche Mode. I rate her 4/10.Overall score: 7/10Special Infected: (These will not get ratings)The Jockey: This small infected jumps on your head and claws at your face. People think it's humping you, IT REALLY ISN'T.He has an annoying maniacal laugh and I ♥♥♥♥ING HATE THIS THING.The Charger: This large infected runs into you and tries to separate you from the other survivors to smash the hell out og you. His right arm is his main weapon, he grabs survivors and hits them with it too. His left arm doesn't do anything but flap with every movement. People say it's cause he masturbates a lot. (Which is actually not funny k.) I believe that his left arm was not operating correctly, he had a muscle not working in it causing the infection to spread on the right side, or all the nutrients he had were separated to the right side. There is many theories but let's just say CAUSE HE DOES.The Spitter: This medium but somewhat tall infected spits corrosive acid at the survivors in attempt to damage them, not kill. She has a sagging stomach, sagging breasts and a pink thong. Ew. Her reason for her method of attack seems rather more scientific, but I wouldn't know how to describe it in the best words. x.x Sorry.Campaigns: There are a bit more campaigns in L4D2 compared to L4D.Dead CenterThe ParishSwamp FeverHard RainDark Carnival, andThe PassingMy personal favorite campaigns are The Parish and Hard Rain.Overall:Left 4 Dead 2 is a great game for people who like teamwork, action, survival, strategy and simply zombie killing.Have fun! :)

content:
Posted: September 28, 2014
												+ Great game idea, good graphics engine (works even on a toaster).- Sloppy game/server logics coding.I could moan about LOADS of stuff in this game, it would be as fat as a bible, but i'l try to make it short.# This is the most unfriendly game to newbies.I played it for 2k hours, so I went all the way from newb to skilled player through kicks and humiliation, and guess what you get at the end ? You become the one who kicks and humiliates. This is just stupid.Your teammates affect your score and success directly. Newbie teammates could lead entire team straight into the grave and make you scream and rage at them for stupidity, so you are forced to kick new players.This is a bad game design, your teammates should only be able to boost your score, not completely ruin it.Great examples which doesn't have those issues are TF2 or even CS. They might have a little bit of that, but it's not as bad as in Left4Dead.# Low ping in this game is crucial. On 5-15 ms it's all good and intuitive, but on 150-200+ ms you have to compensate the ping time yourself for everything but bullets, so playing it on high ping is 3x harder. Try to jockey the player who's running away from you on 200+ ping and you'll get what i mean. It just doesn't work.# Modded servers are a crime against your own game.# Matchmaking is poor. Skilled players should match with other skilled players, while newbs should go with other newbs, but this just ain't happening. It's always very hard to find decent opponents and teammates that match your skill level.# Game logics is full of bugs to the point where it can't get any worse. Any kind of bugs, you name it - they have it.

number of helpful: 57 of 107 people (53%) found this review helpful8 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 14, 2016
												Ahhh Where do i start....I got this game for really cheap, 4$ to be exact, on a random weekend sale.I know, not everyone is going to respect my opinion, since i "Just got 30 hrs" in this game.I loved this game, i was so hyped for getting it downloaded the second i bought it. At the time this was the game i needed in my life. But that opinion quickly changed...So.. This game is supposed to be casual, it just has some fun gamemodes, no ranked, no competitive ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t.But, there are still (80% of players) people that take this game way too ♥♥♥♥ing seriously.Like, there is nothing wrong if you want to be good, or you just wanna win, but here's where the problem starts:IF you call out teammates for being bad, and not even giving them a chance to improve (Calling a vote to kick, and ofc everyone votes ♥♥♥♥ing yes.) that is a scummy thing to do.IF you're being butthurt in the chat while you're playing a CASUAL game, you are an ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥!And so much more...Here, this is my story: I Was never particularly good at fps games, but I enjoy a lot of them.This game is one of them, BUT as I said I'm not good.(I miss a lot, I'm not very good at controlling recoil, and I have a poor eyesight.) And, today i tried to play 4 times:1. I was bad with ♥♥♥♥ing boomer, i got kicked.2. Someone overreacted to something i did, and i called him out.3. I couldn't help my teammates up 1 round, and we lost that one.4. I was in realism, and I couldn't help my teammate, and i got captured by a jockey, so we lost that ONE ROUND.I literally couldn't play 1 ♥♥♥♥ing game without getting kicked for not being MLG PRO.If you couldn't tell, I'm ♥♥♥♥ing mad, just reviewing my experience with this game.I Loved this game, and I still want to, but these people just drag me away.But... If after all this, you think you can handle these butthurt pieces of♥♥♥♥♥♥ I can recommend the game for you because, as i said, its fun. It's probably the best Zombie themed games out there. Plus with addons, you can make it seem like a completely different game, which I find very good, and it pumps up the fun.So in conclusion, This game is very good, but people playing it will drag most people away from playing it more.So... Who should buy this game? Hardly trigerred people with nerves made out of rope. Pro Cod zombies players. No-life ♥♥♥♥.However... I won't stop you from buying it, just keep this in mind...

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 18, 2015
												I'll have over 2000 hours in this game by the time you read this.  If that isn't endorsement enough...It's not even a game about zombies, really.  Assuming you've played a shooter before, it's a game about timing, and communication with your three teammates.  Accordingly, playing with friends, and microphones, is a must to minimize frustration.The game is fine tuned so that, if you are to be successful, you WILL care about your teammates.  You WILL cover them, and save them whenever possible.  In Versus mode, you WILL be scared of open pits and windows, and you WILL treat other hazards like spit, alarmed cars, and witches with respect.  There are a zillion different ways to play, between campaign/versus/scavenge/survival, realism mode, mutations, mods, and self-imposed house rules.TL;DR: Some people have played World of Warcraft with their friends every night for years.  Left 4 Dead 2 is my WoW.
