content:
Posted: May 26, 2014
												Left 4 Dead 2 is like one of those arcade games where you shoot zombies. You can select your campaign, or "map", and each one lasts from 30 to 90 minutes. Guns and other items randomly spawn around the map. There are also "ammo piles", which are basically infinite sources of ammo for your guns that you can find. There are also medpacks and other HP items that you can use. Furthermore, upgrades for your guns, like temporary fire ammo or laser sights, spawn in certain areas. Now do you get what I mean by "arcade-like"?Personally, I loved this game when I got into it. I played the first four campaigns on my first day playing this, and adored them all. My favorite part of this game is how the levels look and are layed out. I don't want to spoil anything, but some of them are pretty creative.Every couple of minutes you'll probably encounter a "Special Infected", or a zombie that has an ability that can screw you over in two seconds. Some can pounce on you and start ripping you to shreds, while others cover you in vomit that blinds you and makes you a zombie magnet for a while. However, there is one Special Infected that has a unique ability from the others, which I won't spoil.However, as much as I loved this game when I first played it, there are some downsides. After a few campaigns shooting zombies gets repetitive. Most of this game is just "shoot the zombie" and "shoot the other zombie" as you make your way through maps. Although Special Infected make it a bit more interesting, I would like to see more variety in enemies if they make a third game. However, seeing and exploring the maps is still fun, along with playing with friends and sometimes online (The community isn't exactly the best I've seen).Overall, I would recommend this game to anyone who likes exploring, or arcade-like zombie shooters. Although it does get repetitive fast, there are things that encourage you to play like co-op and other game modes. Plus there's Steaam Workshop for this game, so you can download user-created campaigns or change your flashlight to an image of Shrek.

content:
Posted: December 29, 2013
												One of the best co-op games I have ever played. Some people say that this game is linear (what games don't have linearity?). While it is true, the extensive modding community add so many unique characters, maps, weapons, and tactical situations that the linearity completely disappears, leaving behind a hectic battle for survival. You have multiple modes of gameplay. You can either fend for yourself in single player with bot helpers, go through a map with friends in campaign, or fight as infected in Versus and Scavenge. The difficulty modes add a lot of variety, as well. Expert requires the FPS skills of a Call Of Duty or Counter-Strike veteran and the teamwork of life-long friends. It's never tiring to go through any map, because there's so many ways to go through it and so many different situations. The events that happen because of it creates a lot of laughs and a lot of inspiring frustration. It can only get better from here as Valve releases sequels.

content:
Posted: March 8, 2014
												What I can easily say about this game, DAMN it never gets old. The old fasioned "Work together or die" aspect is retro enough for an oldies gamer, but the feel of the game is new enough that any of our current generation players could enjoy it. Personally, people who buy this game just for the Frying Pan and Ellis' Hat in Team Fortress 2, you don't know what your missing. If you're wanting a game to relax and enjoy, simply Solo campaign with AI Special Infected is just for you...but if you're wanting that competitive feel, Versus is great. You can take Arena-like Scavenge, or even play the campaigns in a competitive format of Versus, where the Infected human players work to stop you AS SOON AS POSSIBLE. Your goal? Get farther than the other team in the campaign.This variety in the game, of both co-op and competitive, is what makes me come back. Even after several campaign playthroughs of both L4D1 and L4D2, if one gets boring I would switch to a competitive gamemode to see the game from another aspect. Truly, indeed worth the ten bucks paid during a sale (lol). WARNING: Competitive gamemodes most enjoyable with knowledge and understanding of the game. Understanding, not just game mechanics and items, but how to operate the infected. Have fun playing Charger and taking people off cliffs, rooftops, or docks and killing them instantly!

content:
Posted: November 20, 2015
Tl;DRAmazing game that caters to both casual and competitive players as long as you stay in your own lane. If you only want fun, stay away from versus, or atleast play it with friends only. Has plenty of replay value and quality content that's worth the money, especially on sales when it goes down to $4.99. Be prepared to deal with ♥♥♥♥♥♥ people. Don't take it too seriously! More in depth below.So by now you've probably heard a good amount of what the game is like, and having played it for so long, I know what's accurate and what's not and so I'll try to condense all of it here, though before saying anything else, I'd overall recommend it despite the many negative aspects of the game. The goodL4D2 is a wonderfully innovative game full of humor, fun and addicting gameplay, and detail. The game does a very good job of centering the game around good teamwork and taking an entirely new concept I've never seen in any other game. I'm absolutely in love with it. Though despite this, it's also a huge part of what can make the game incredibly frustrating, i.e. your teammates are really bad and you die/lose all your health because of this etc. Regardless this game is incredibly fun and gives you so much replay value that you just may never tire of it, the steam workshop being a major contributor to this, giving you tons of new content ranging from gun remodels to entire new campaigns and game modes. If you have some friends are interested in this type of game in general, I'd definitely recommend it to you.Now here comes the community aspect of the game, the main thing everyone talks about. I am talking about VERSUS in particulr here. Is it bad? Yes. Does it make it unplayable? No. Do you need some tolerance/patience? Yes. There are definitely a fair share of utter ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s out there that play this game, though most of the reviews I see on here blow this out of proportion for the wrong reasons or aren't accurate. Some people will kick you because theyre ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s, some will kick you because they just don't want noobs on their team, some kick you just because they want to make room for friends. For the last 2 of these reasons, the main thing that stems from this is the fact THAT MANY PEOPLE DON'T LISTEN IN THIS GAME. You have people repeatedly giving instructions over their mic or in game chat telling someone to do something simple and in a nice way, and a huge portion of people, for whatever reason, just DON'T LISTEN. This is a very frustrating thing to deal with considering this game requires a fair deal of communication, as do most cooperative games. So as a result of this, many people are kick happy. Even if you do listen, you're probably going to be kicked at some point anyway; not that I personally do this. Basically, you have to be willing to communicate and learn the game. Understand that if you get kicked for something that is seemingly for nothing, IT'S PROBABLY WITHIN REASON. Others tht have written reviews for the game complaining about being kicked over "nothing" skill related probably have it in their head that their way is the only way. Having so many hours, I'd definitely know.That's versus. In campaign, it's really not that bad. For the most part you can simply play along with whatever you want and not worry that much about people harassing you or trolling or whatever it is, though you'll still encounter this sometimes anyway. If you're a casual player looking for fun then I would definitely stick to campaign, probably play with friends, whatever. If you wanna really get into versus, then I'd play campaign for a while first to learn how the game works, and then move onto versus. There's a lot to learn to this and I'll tell you right now: you will probably not have fun playing versus due to a lack of skill. The way the game is designed makes it this way, sadly, as the game, or pubs anyway, are filled with random stomps, trolls, ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s, etc, and getting destroyed every single game you play isn't very fun. So again, if you're casual and don't intend to learn the competitive side of the game that versus is, I'd stay away from it. Play versus with an all friends game if you really want to have fun with it.The badMany of the main complaints I, as well as many others have with the game is the numerous amount of glitches and bugs the game contains that Valve hasn't bothered to fix. If you're a casual player, you probably won't notice these things and I wouldn't bother reading this section if so as it hardly affects you. But if you're going to play the game for the competitive aspect, be prepared to deal with many unfair mechanics, such as chargers bumping right off of survivors as if they were a wall, jockeys not stumbling at all when you shove them allowing them to grab you instantly, getting hit by tank punches several melee lengths away, etc. This makes the game extremely frustrating, as well as with Valve's newest useless update, many of the servers are broken and unplayable, have all red pings, etc. You should really stick to competitive servers unless you don't mind dealing with pubs. Other than this, the game's pretty okay, there's not much else negative to it aside from the community. Except this game can get you fueled with rage at times regardless, lol

content:
Posted: March 15, 2014
												Left 4 Dead 2 is a multiplayer zombie FPS game, completely based on teamwork. Let's put this quick and short. You know how in most multiplayer zombie games, you can just leave your team and be the hero? Well, in Left 4 Dead, if you try that stunt, you WILL die. Your team needs to work together to make it through countless hordes of zombies, Special Infected, obstacles, and hardest of all, Tanks. The Special Infected include all the S.I. from the old game, plus three new ones: The Charger, the Spitter, and the Jockey. Here is a list of all the Special Infected and their abilities:Hunter: Pounces on you and doesn't let go unless killed or shoved.Boomer: Vomits on you and attracts zombies to you. Explodes vomit everywhere when killed.Smoker: Constricts you with a long tongue and doesn't let go unless killed or you are shoved. Releases a cloud of smoke when killed.Spitter: Spits acid at you that cause damage. Releases a pool of acid when killed.The Jockey: Rides on your head and drags you sometimes into danger or more zombies. Does not let go unless killed or shoved off.The Charger: Charges at you from a distance and pummels you into the ground. Doesn't let go unless killed.Two major Special Infected include the Witch and the Tank:The Witch: a crying Infected woman who, when provoked by either loud sounds, light, or proximity of survivors, will attack the provoker and any other Survivors after her provoker is dead. She can incapacitate or even kill a Survivor in one hit. The Witch was in the first game as well, but Left 4 Dead 2 introduces a variant of the Witch that wanders aimlessly in the open.The Tank: a gigantic, extremely muscular Infected male with the strength to punch Survivors off their feet some distance, as well as toss cars and concrete slabs. Unless the Survivors work as a team, they will be quickly incapacitated or even killed by the Tank's inhuman strength.Other enemies include normal zombies, Clowns, Hazmat Suits, Construction Workers, Mudmen, etc. The Story goes like this (This is going to be a lot of information so sit tight and read it all if you want):     The Sacrifice DLC campaign takes place before the main events of Left 4 Dead 2; and after the events of The Sacrifice comic. The original survivors of Left 4 Dead—Bill, Francis, Louis, and Zoey—arrive at the portside town of Rayford, in order to search for a boat that can take them to the Florida Keys. After finding an adequate sailboat, the Survivors have to manually start up generators in order to lift a bridge for their boat to pass through. One Survivor (canonically Bill) sacrifices himself in order to kick-start a generator once it gives out, so that the others may reach safety. This is the end of Bill's story in the Left 4 Dead video game series.      Left 4 Dead 2 opens in Dead Center (set in Savannah, Georgia), where the four Survivors find themselves abandoned on a hotel roof by rescue helicopters. They decide to head for the local mall, where a second CEDA evacuation point is located. After a brief encounter with a gun store owner, Whitaker (voiced by Dayton Callie), the Survivors discover that the mall is overrun, with all CEDA agents having become either dead or infected as well. Ellis helps the group use a stock car to bust out of the mall and travel towards New Orleans, rumored to be the last standing city in America.     The Passing DLC campaign takes place between Dead Center and Dark Carnival, and after the events of The Sacrifice campaign. The Survivors of L4D2 arrive at the bridge in Rayford, where they meet Francis, Louis, and Zoey. As they need to cross the bridge to proceed, the Survivors need to find another way across to refill the generator with gas. After fighting their way through a wedding reception (complete with a Witch bride), the streets, and a historic under-the-river tour, they meet up again with the original Survivors, who help by covering for the group while they fill the generator and lowering the bridge once it's full.     At the start of the Dark Carnival campaign, the four Survivors find the highway ahead completely blocked by ditched vehicles, and are forced to travel on foot through an abandoned (but still-operating) amusement park. After navigating their way to the park stadium, Coach devises a plan to use a large-scale light show used by a rock band, The Midnight Riders, in order to signal a helicopter pilot for rescue.     After being rescued, they later discover that their pilot has been Infected. When the pilot starts attacking them, Nick is forced to kill him (echoing a similar situation in the first game), causing the chopper to crash into a bayou, the setting for Swamp Fever. Working their way through the swamps, the group comes across a crashed airplane, dead military paratroopers, and isolated swamp villages which had held out against the Infected but were eventually overrun. After spending the morning fighting through the swamp, the group arrives at a plantation mansion and make radio contact with Virgil, a Cajun boat captain who can assist them; however, his boat begins to run low on diesel fuel on the way to New Orleans. As a tumultuous rainstorm approaches (the titular Hard Rain of the subsequent campaign), the Survivors go ashore at Ducatel, Mississippi; make their way through an abandoned (and Witch-infested) sugarcane mill to a gas station to get diesel fuel, and return to signal Virgil with an improvised "flare".     In the final campaign, The Parish, Virgil drops the group off at New Orleans, where the military appears to be evacuating civilians across a bridge. On the way there, the four discover the city overrun with Infected, and that the military is actually leaving the city before it is destroyed by an air strike. The group manages to reach the bridge, where they make contact with the military. Judging from their dialogue, the military pilots suspect the Survivors to be "carriers", similar to the original Survivors of Left 4 Dead. After securing their rescue helicopter, the Survivors lower and cross the bridge, escaping on the helicopter just as the bridge is destroyed.  While the Survivors' fate is left unclear after this point, Chet Faliszek, the game's writer, said that the military is taking survivors to cruise ships in the Caribbean in an attempt to escape the infection.Left 4 Dead 2 comes with multiple modes to choose from. These modes are: Single Player, Multiplayer, Realism, Versus, Scavenge, Survival, and Mutation.Single Player is your basic finish the campaign and survive. Nothing much more to say.Multiplayer is the same thing, only with other players instead of bots.Realism mode makes things harder, like no regeneration and the actual time of helping people up in a horde of zombies.Versus is one team is the infected and the other team is the Survivors. The survivors have to go through the campaign without getting killed by the zombie players. The teams alternate everytime a safehouse is reached or the Survivors die.Scavenge is similar to the Dead Center finale, where you have to fill up a take with gas cans. Only in this mode, its not just Dead Center, it's all the other campaigns as well. Just fill the tank with gas. Nothing more.Survival gives you all the weapons and items, and forces you to try and survive against waves upon waves of zombies. The only objective is to see how far you can get.All in all, with a fantastic storyline, great multiplayer, unsettling atmosphere, and so much variety, Left 4 Dead 2 lives up to its predecesor, and is a game that I recommend to everyone who enjoys playing with friends and shooting zombies in the face.

content:
Posted: May 26, 2014
												Left 4 Dead 2 is like one of those arcade games where you shoot zombies. You can select your campaign, or "map", and each one lasts from 30 to 90 minutes. Guns and other items randomly spawn around the map. There are also "ammo piles", which are basically infinite sources of ammo for your guns that you can find. There are also medpacks and other HP items that you can use. Furthermore, upgrades for your guns, like temporary fire ammo or laser sights, spawn in certain areas. Now do you get what I mean by "arcade-like"?Personally, I loved this game when I got into it. I played the first four campaigns on my first day playing this, and adored them all. My favorite part of this game is how the levels look and are layed out. I don't want to spoil anything, but some of them are pretty creative.Every couple of minutes you'll probably encounter a "Special Infected", or a zombie that has an ability that can screw you over in two seconds. Some can pounce on you and start ripping you to shreds, while others cover you in vomit that blinds you and makes you a zombie magnet for a while. However, there is one Special Infected that has a unique ability from the others, which I won't spoil.However, as much as I loved this game when I first played it, there are some downsides. After a few campaigns shooting zombies gets repetitive. Most of this game is just "shoot the zombie" and "shoot the other zombie" as you make your way through maps. Although Special Infected make it a bit more interesting, I would like to see more variety in enemies if they make a third game. However, seeing and exploring the maps is still fun, along with playing with friends and sometimes online (The community isn't exactly the best I've seen).Overall, I would recommend this game to anyone who likes exploring, or arcade-like zombie shooters. Although it does get repetitive fast, there are things that encourage you to play like co-op and other game modes. Plus there's Steaam Workshop for this game, so you can download user-created campaigns or change your flashlight to an image of Shrek.

content:
Posted: March 8, 2014
												What I can easily say about this game, DAMN it never gets old. The old fasioned "Work together or die" aspect is retro enough for an oldies gamer, but the feel of the game is new enough that any of our current generation players could enjoy it. Personally, people who buy this game just for the Frying Pan and Ellis' Hat in Team Fortress 2, you don't know what your missing. If you're wanting a game to relax and enjoy, simply Solo campaign with AI Special Infected is just for you...but if you're wanting that competitive feel, Versus is great. You can take Arena-like Scavenge, or even play the campaigns in a competitive format of Versus, where the Infected human players work to stop you AS SOON AS POSSIBLE. Your goal? Get farther than the other team in the campaign.This variety in the game, of both co-op and competitive, is what makes me come back. Even after several campaign playthroughs of both L4D1 and L4D2, if one gets boring I would switch to a competitive gamemode to see the game from another aspect. Truly, indeed worth the ten bucks paid during a sale (lol). WARNING: Competitive gamemodes most enjoyable with knowledge and understanding of the game. Understanding, not just game mechanics and items, but how to operate the infected. Have fun playing Charger and taking people off cliffs, rooftops, or docks and killing them instantly!

content:
Posted: May 14, 2014
												I was introduced into the L4D universe in the first one, I never really got to play it but some time later L4D2 came out and I bought after remembering the fun my friends had playing the first one. All from each other’s houses and that seemed fun.So first thing about the game I’d like to talk about is the survivors. I understand leaving the first cast behind must have been somewhat though in the begging, however they first cast made it back in the awesome free DLC that completely defeated the purpose of having bought the first game.Personality wise, the new guys were kind of a letdown, Coach and Nick were alright for me, they could bring seriousness and humor into the game at the same time, Rochelle however was just as bland as a concrete slab and Ellis was just there to be the group clown with the ever-comical southern accent. I think they were alright and somehow ran away from the typical zombie survivor template but the first group felt like the formula and they should have left it that way.Next step brings us to the special infected. Having more of them instead of replacements was just right, the combos they could make both as bots or in competitive were nice, such as having a Spitter burning you up whenever you got pinned by one of the other infected, Jockeys dragging you away from the group when you are barely in the safe room, Chargers making the whole group fly into walls... It was nice to have to be more mindful about other threats. I’d also like to mention the “uncommon” infected from each chapter, they were like the chocolate chips on a normal horde cookie; they stood out, had a different function but were not as imposing as a special infected.To keep this review from being too long I’ll stand by the items and weapons. Most notably we have the new melee weapons. Many people leave those behind because they can shove with the normal weapons and gameplay wise some people considered them useless or unbalanced. I simply loved them, some were funny or simply badass but nothing beats mowing down a horde when close to death under adrenaline with a guitar while the rest of the group is back you up with guns from behind. Parts fly off, heads get smashed in and you get covered in the blood of your enemies. Melee is satisfying when used right... or with a chainsaw.The new guns were also cool, the magnum simply made a neat line of infected explode with a shot, the SCAR-H’s permanent burst fire was also something nice to have when you wanted more accurate shots without having to worry about the trigger, then that huge machine gun that came in the DLC was simply delicious to use, very limited ammo and no reloads, you just wait for a horde to unload it and scream the inner Rambo in you and lastly the grenade launcher that you should simply leave if you are not good with it or you are willing to sacrifice everyone’s health for some copious amounts of intestines flying off.Some more important new features were the defib packs that came to steal the importance of first-aid kits, the adrenaline shots that were perfect for that tight moment, the boomer bile to throw in a fire or at a tank, so much fun and lastly the weapon mods like laser sights and incendiary/explosive ammo, more tools to cause mayhem and survive in style.Overall, it’s a nice game to sink an afternoon in with friends, if you don’t have friends to play you can join random games but it’s not as fun. A mic is highly recommended to have higher survival chances. In case you get bored from running from zombies, there are game modes that allow to play as one or to hold your ground against waves of infected meat. There’s also the dreaded realism mode that removes all visual and audio hints and forces you group to be tight and communicate everything and on last word I’d like to talk about the maps, it’s the southern ‘merica experience and a refreshing area to play in, all the way to New Orleans.TL;DR: I am Rodrigosth and I recommend this game to you and your friends to play together.Special thanks to Hirow to help me keep my facts straight.

content:
Posted: December 29, 2013
												One of the best co-op games I have ever played. Some people say that this game is linear (what games don't have linearity?). While it is true, the extensive modding community add so many unique characters, maps, weapons, and tactical situations that the linearity completely disappears, leaving behind a hectic battle for survival. You have multiple modes of gameplay. You can either fend for yourself in single player with bot helpers, go through a map with friends in campaign, or fight as infected in Versus and Scavenge. The difficulty modes add a lot of variety, as well. Expert requires the FPS skills of a Call Of Duty or Counter-Strike veteran and the teamwork of life-long friends. It's never tiring to go through any map, because there's so many ways to go through it and so many different situations. The events that happen because of it creates a lot of laughs and a lot of inspiring frustration. It can only get better from here as Valve releases sequels.

content:
Posted: May 9, 2016
												Left 4 Dead 2 (L4D2) is a game made by Valve, about four survivors that have to go from a point A to point B, while defending themselves from zombies.------------------Gameplay: 9.5/10Gameplay is really nice. You have various gamemodes, many weapons, different types of zombies. Sometimes the game crashes or lags, it's rare. There are bugs, too and many tricks for both surivors and zombies. Also Valve is no longer updating that game, sadly.-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Graphics: 10/10 Graphics are great, same with other SRC Engine games. You can compare them to textures from HL2, but they have different looks. Sometimes there are objects that appeared in other games, but that's normal in SRC Engine. Right now im playing on highest graphics, and it's working on 60 fps. By the way, i don't have a good PC, it can't handle Payday 2-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Sounds/Soundtracks: 9,5/10Nothing much to say about that. There aren't alot of soundtracks, but there are various sounds. Check them yourself.-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------So, i RECOMMEND that game, it has alot of fun in itself, great to play with friends. Also, L4D2 has L4D AND L4D2 in itself, so do not buy the first game, unless you want to collect it. It's also a bit expensive, i prefer buying on a sale, which is very common. Great job Valve, great job.

content:
Posted: September 26, 2014
												Left 4 Dead 2 is a multiplayer first person shooter where you play one of four survivors attempting it to make it to the end of successive maps, surviving hordes of zombies. The zombies are attracted by sound and light, so your actions can determine how many you have to fight, in addition to a number of special infected who each have special abilities designed to inflict damage and/or separate the group.In addition to the normal co-op campaign, there is also a vs form of multiplayer where two teams of four take turns acting as special infected, trying to kill the other team as rapidly as possible. This is where the game really shines, especially if you've got a group of friends with which you can regularly fill a whole game of 8.The game is a quality single-player game to play through once, but its value really comes in the replayability of these multiplayer modes, as well as the multitude of player-designed maps and Steam Workshop content.I have not put more time into any other game on Steam.Highly, highly recommended, particularly if you've got some friends to play with.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 9, 2016
												Left 4 Dead 2 (L4D2) is a game made by Valve, about four survivors that have to go from a point A to point B, while defending themselves from zombies.------------------Gameplay: 9.5/10Gameplay is really nice. You have various gamemodes, many weapons, different types of zombies. Sometimes the game crashes or lags, it's rare. There are bugs, too and many tricks for both surivors and zombies. Also Valve is no longer updating that game, sadly.-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Graphics: 10/10 Graphics are great, same with other SRC Engine games. You can compare them to textures from HL2, but they have different looks. Sometimes there are objects that appeared in other games, but that's normal in SRC Engine. Right now im playing on highest graphics, and it's working on 60 fps. By the way, i don't have a good PC, it can't handle Payday 2-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Sounds/Soundtracks: 9,5/10Nothing much to say about that. There aren't alot of soundtracks, but there are various sounds. Check them yourself.-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------So, i RECOMMEND that game, it has alot of fun in itself, great to play with friends. Also, L4D2 has L4D AND L4D2 in itself, so do not buy the first game, unless you want to collect it. It's also a bit expensive, i prefer buying on a sale, which is very common. Great job Valve, great job.

content:
Posted: March 9, 2014
												Very fun game. I very much enjoy when about 3 zombies run up around you and you can't move an inch and even when you spray about 18 shotgun shells into their face it seems to do nothing because Valve is such a great game company and has amazing coders. I also love the times when I am running from a Tank and then one little zombie hits me and causes me to go from running to a complete stop in about 2 miliseconds, but that's okay, I enjoy getting fisted by the tank. Another thing I enjoy is when it takes about 15 minutes to heal yourself with one med-pack. I think this adds alot of time so you can think about what a fun game you are playing. Even better than that is when your teammates or bots heal you with a med-pack. Nothing screams "I love you" more than when you heal someone with a med-pack that takes 10 minutes to use at the end of the finale. By far my favorite thing is the wide variety of characters to choose from. You get to choose between a redneck, a gambler, a fat black man and a ghetto/sassy black girl. Overall this game is perfect in every way. I rate it 10/10.

content:
Posted: July 23, 2011
												Left 4 Dead 2 is a great game. Say what you will about the way Valve treated the L4D community by delivering a sequel so quickly, but there's no denying that L4D2 is a better, more polished game than the first.This version adds new weapons, new healing options, and new special infected zombies that weren't present in the first. It doesn't really change gameplay much, but it does add a bit of variety that the original lacked. The maps are solid, and the weather effects are great, particularly in the Hard Rain level. The melee weapons that the first game painfully lacked are finally present here.There is an active map-building community, and Valve continues to offer official maps and gameplay support. This gives the game a fair amount of replay value. But most of the replay value comes from the Versus mode. A game of L4D2 Versus is a great experience that never gets tired.

												Its a pretty good game. It has a really cliche story line, but still not bad. Four strangers depending on one another due to compromising circumstances. number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 11, 2015
												Every wanted to run crazily through a horde of zombies while screaming at your friends to shoot the small warted zombie riding on your shoulders trying to rip your head off?! Well this games for you!Pros+One of the best COOP experiences and up to 4 players.+Active community still(as of this writing)+Great modding community to add cool characters and weapon/equipment skins.+Gameplay feels great and smooth.+Zombie vs. Human online versus mode is fun and a great time killer.+5+ campaigns to play through around.+Some cool tricks and optimization could make this a fun game to speedrun.=Teamwork is key to this game. You can play solo, but COOP is where this game really shines and if you are not willing to cooperate then it might not be for you.Cons-Campaigns are a little short for some people, will take around 35-45 mins per campaign for new players depending on skills level.-Online players without mics, please for the love of Gaben almighty, if you are going to play an online COOP game please get and use a mic. This makes communicating and strategizing much easier and can make the gaming session much mroe enjoyable.Final thoughtIf you like zombie games, fast paced shooters or teamwork inspired gameplay, then you will love Left 4 Dead 2. This is a great successor to the first left for dead and does the series justice.

Posted: September 23, 2016
												Ever since 2009 when the only gameplay platform I had was an Xbox 360, Left 4 Dead 2 has always been my favorite game to exist to this day. No game has ever captivated me in gameplay and atmosphere like Left 4 Dead as a series has. Left 4 Dead 2 holds so much signifigance, as it was my gateway into gaming itself. I do believe that without this game, I wouldn't be as into First-Person Shooters or Post-Apocalyptic games as I am now. It's amazing to see that a game I enjoyed back in 2009 is still going strong with a playerbase in 2016, and the game is certainly one of the best games Valve has ever created and Turtle Rock Studios has ever sparked.Even though it is still going strong, it's a lie to say the game isn't dying. At it's prime, Left 4 Dead 2 had a 161,590 all-time peak (Not including console players), whereas games at it's time like Team Fortress 2 only reached a 110,000 all-time peak. It's very admirable and impressive, but Left 4 Dead 2's community is always steadily declining. However, the workshop has definitely kept a lot of players around, and me being an avid Versus player, I rarely ever run into the same person twice (probably 0.001% of games I've played have been with at most one person I've seen before, and that's only in the late-night hours).Overall, the game is amazing. Even after 7 years, the game is still amazing and still impresses. If you currently don't own Left 4 Dead 2, you're missing out on gaming history.

content:
Posted: April 14, 2014
												This is definitely a fun game with an abundance of players and for the most part very nice people. There are many maps and many mods that are easy to download free and install. It is liner and repetitive although it has a lot of variation not only as to the map changing when you replay but also the monsters spawn in a variety of numbers. Then add in the players who join the game can also effect how you have to adapt to their skill or lack their of. It is a team player game and is easy to live chat each other. It lacks stealth, exploration, and adventure, but makes up for it with hours of fun killing Zombies and making it to the end of the session. Hardly ever a glitch, the graphics are good, and even if you can not get in a game with people you can play with robots to practice and learn the maps.I rate it only 3.5 stars only because of this constant desire to not always having to be running.  I am still hoping for another game like Metro that is multiplayer.

content:
Posted: August 4, 2014
												Why Left 4 Dead 2 is one of the greatest games ever madeHave you ever asked yourself, “if the zombie apocalypse were to happen right now, what would I use to defend myself?” That’s like Left 4 Dead 2. Sure, it’s got first-person shooter gunplay at its heart, but with ammo limited, sooner or later you’re going to have to choose between a garden gnome or an electric guitar with which to smash up the undead hordes and save your frontal lobes from a trip through a zombie’s digestive tract. Brilliantly, despite such comical situations, Left 4 Dead 2 plays it all totally straight. The atmosphere is dark and dank with a terrifying feeling of hopelessness as you and your team make it to every new safehouse in a worse state than before.

												Although I have had not many hours playing on the PC version of L4D2  I have spent a lot of time playing on the 360 before it broke (don't judge). However I can say that I reallly do love this game, it is one of my favourite games to play. I mean I love it so much as soon as I couldn't play it on 360 anymore I got it again on PC. It is one of the best co-op games out there and the game came out in 2009. The gameplay is incredible and really fun even if you're playing singleplayer. I wouldn't recommend getting the game if singleplayer is your preferable choice because sometimes it can be dull (not to mention how bad the A.I's are on this game). As long as you got some friends to play the game with then I seriously suggest picking up this game. The only bad point I can think about on this game is the online commuinty. If you slip up once playing a co-op game with strangers you're gonna get kicked, no matter how small the slip up. I once took a medkit and got kicked for that. Overall though I do suggest to pick this game up, even if the community does suck♥♥♥♥♥♥for crack money. 10/10

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 3, 2012
												Long has it been said that Left 4 Dead shouldn't have had a sequel, but they did and I'm still so happy to this day that they did. No other game has made me laugh so much at friends screaming as a Hunter ripped them to shreds, curse so much that one of the Bots took so long to respond to my death screams or concentrate so hard when trying to get a 25 damage pounce during Versus mode.This game has consumed so much of my time that I look back and realise I don't regret any of those hours I spent in game. Not only that but the durability of this game with mods and maps is just fantastic and keeps me coming back for more.For a long period I had stopped playing this game, realising it was probably dying a slow death and the servers were all the same and getting kicked for no reason by ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s was a constant fear. I have put those fears aside by playing exclusively on the Marvelous Gaming servers, with no reason to fear being kicked ever again.If you're looking for a game experience that keeps on giving and a community that keeps on creating, you can't look past Left 4 Dead 2. The gaming landscape is continuously evolving and L4D2 is keeping up through it's endless supply of mods and maps released on the Workshop. For me, this is my 'Game of the Decade'.;tldrGet this game at full price, half price or that one time when it was free for 24hrs... you won't regret it!

												I should've realized this game is great when I saw it's made by Valve. But I thought meh, co-op shooting can't be that fun. Well, it's not just fun, it's uber-fun. Good thing they offered it for free that Christmas day, otherwise I would've probably never tried it, and I would've missed hours of fun.Playing versus mode is my favorite. Being a "special infected" hunting survivors was incredibly entertaining, both challenging and... so rewarding. Managing to isolate one of my friends who played a survivor, then kick the xxxx out of him and ruin his team's score felt better than a Dota rampage.I also like the characters (though I wouldn't have minded if the chicks were even sexier), the story, the many modes, the variety of monsters and locations - briefly, everything about this game.

content:
Posted: September 9, 2014
												This game is absolutely amazing! Another masterpiece among games. You are one of four survivors in a post-zombie apocolyptic survival world. Fighting your way through hordes of zombies ad special infected, to reach safe houses. There are may ways to enjoy the game, from campaign to multiplayer, and all in between. the weapons are extensive, and create a proud feel of having a weapon that suits you. there are even trowables such as molotovs and pipe bombs, pick-me-ups like pain killers for addd health, and a flashlight for when things get dark and scary. If you are looking for an adrenaline rush of gameplay, zombies, co-op, and all around fun, this game shouts "buy me!"

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 25, 2015
												Pros :+ One of the best Co Op games of all time+ One of the pioneer of zombie Co Op survival game+ Epic workshop mods.The basic game DOES gets boring after a while even if you're playing with your friends.But with the mods  installed ? The replay value is now much more improved.Imagine shooting Skyrim dragons instead of tanks.Stormtroopers instead of zombies.Dota heroes instead of special zombies.Epic fun and seriously funny.You can change almost everything.+ Challenging,but still gives you the much needed fun.You can still enjoy playing it without getting frustrated.+ Storyline isn't empty anymore.The mission has its story and reasons for you to play along.+ Fun gameplay modes.Co Op Zombie survival isn't the only option.Cons :- Devs should add more levels.People will get bored if they never update the mission.They can't rely on workshop maps alone.- Not all people wants to spend their time searching for good maps and typing commands in order to make their installed mods compatible.This is one of the reasons they should add more official levels rather than depending on workshop maps.- Limited guns options.Even though with the epic workshop skin edits,more gun options will make the game way much more interesting.And it will offer more weapons for the skin editors to mod.They should make Left 4 Dead 3 with epic graphics like Dying Light/CoD/Battlefield/Crysis etc.No old games will stay for long .Nothing will thrive in the future if they keep forcing the old ways into the new modern gamer community.Even Counter-Strike make Global Offensive.Why don't Left 4 Dead make a new sequel with updated engine ?

content:
Posted: October 30, 2015
												Hey everyone. Let's talk about the game, which I wasted 3+ years of my life. I gotta say that L4D2 is a very fun game to play especially with friends. But if you don't have any friends (like me) and you want to play this game, then... well... good luck then. And what I meant by that?Newbies are fine. If they're not deaf and can communicate, then it's absolutely fine to play with 'em. We can play slowly and help each other, help improve and have fun. If you're a newbie and want some help, then you have to be nice. Nobody wants to help rude people with no manners.Try-hards ARE not fine. They're everywhere and if you happen to ♥♥♥♥ up somewhere while playing with 'em. You'll get kicked out from the game without hesitation. The community is getting more and more ♥♥♥♥♥ier. Also, if you enjoy playing on expert, then you'll definitely meet some ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s who just randomly joins the game, shoots everyone and leaves. I'm not even surprised anymore.What I want to say is please think twice, or even thrice, before buying this game. I love this game, but I highly recommend it to peeps who have friends to play with.  Unless you're prepared to get shot down by stupid players and then kicked out from the game.But there's chance that you'll meet good peeps who will probably help you improve. I even found server full of friendly Russians. Search for peeps who focuses on having fun rather than winning. It's not very often you get to meet nice, kind, great teamplayers. But once you do, then all the fun begins.

content:
Posted: November 5, 2015
												This game is pretty much wow once you will get on higher skill level.You are starting to understand all mechanics, system, and it's a time when you realise how amazing the concept of this game is. All the little pieces connecting each other making almost flawless art.I can say i regret some time spent on this game, some matches were crappy, but despite that, i just couldn't stop playing this game. It gives so much fun.The thing i like the most about this game is that it forces you to use brain most of the time, it's not just brainless multiplayer shooting game. Every attack is pretty much predicting enemy, spatial imagination to block spawns at its finest.. you have to be focused all the time. Also you have to make decisions quickly. This are very important skills in real life too.Thing that hurts the most is that L4D2 was "left" by Valve. There are still some bugs that need fix, or like 0 interest in competetive l4d2.3,827 hours on record by now, and i highly doubt it will stop before reaching 5k.Love this game, buy it, learn it, master it.

content:
Posted: August 3, 2012
												Long has it been said that Left 4 Dead shouldn't have had a sequel, but they did and I'm still so happy to this day that they did. No other game has made me laugh so much at friends screaming as a Hunter ripped them to shreds, curse so much that one of the Bots took so long to respond to my death screams or concentrate so hard when trying to get a 25 damage pounce during Versus mode.This game has consumed so much of my time that I look back and realise I don't regret any of those hours I spent in game. Not only that but the durability of this game with mods and maps is just fantastic and keeps me coming back for more.For a long period I had stopped playing this game, realising it was probably dying a slow death and the servers were all the same and getting kicked for no reason by ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s was a constant fear. I have put those fears aside by playing exclusively on the Marvelous Gaming servers, with no reason to fear being kicked ever again.If you're looking for a game experience that keeps on giving and a community that keeps on creating, you can't look past Left 4 Dead 2. The gaming landscape is continuously evolving and L4D2 is keeping up through it's endless supply of mods and maps released on the Workshop. For me, this is my 'Game of the Decade'.;tldrGet this game at full price, half price or that one time when it was free for 24hrs... you won't regret it!

content:
Posted: June 15, 2014
												Imagine Duke Nukem, wielding a master sword, holding off a horde of zombies so that Phoenix Wright, Princess Luna, and Spongebob can escape to the safehouse, cutting down one after another until Hitler dives out from the horde and tackles him ripping out his neck.Later on their journey Luna and Spongebob get into an argument, and Luna tries to resolve it by throwing a molotov cocktail at Spongebob's feet. Spongebob proceeds to pull out an axe and kill Luna. Shortly after Diddy Kong leaps onto his head and pulls him off a building.As the last survivor of his group, Phoenix Wright continues on to the safehouse, determined to get there for the sake of his comrades. Just as he is closing in on his destination, though, he hears I'm Too Sexy For My Shirt playing in the background. His eyes widen. He knows what's coming. Suddenly Shrek appears from around the corner, holding a massive piece of sidewalk in his strong ogre hands. Phoenix turns around, only to find himself faced with Slenderman if he runs. Out of ammo, he decides to go down fighting. Brandishing his frying pan, he charges at Shrek, letting out a scream of rage as he does so.Unfortunately, Phoenix was decapitated by a flying piece of concrete.This is the kind of game Left 4 Dead 2 is.

content:
Posted: November 5, 2015
												This game is pretty much wow once you will get on higher skill level.You are starting to understand all mechanics, system, and it's a time when you realise how amazing the concept of this game is. All the little pieces connecting each other making almost flawless art.I can say i regret some time spent on this game, some matches were crappy, but despite that, i just couldn't stop playing this game. It gives so much fun.The thing i like the most about this game is that it forces you to use brain most of the time, it's not just brainless multiplayer shooting game. Every attack is pretty much predicting enemy, spatial imagination to block spawns at its finest.. you have to be focused all the time. Also you have to make decisions quickly. This are very important skills in real life too.Thing that hurts the most is that L4D2 was "left" by Valve. There are still some bugs that need fix, or like 0 interest in competetive l4d2.3,827 hours on record by now, and i highly doubt it will stop before reaching 5k.Love this game, buy it, learn it, master it.

content:
Posted: October 30, 2015
												Hey everyone. Let's talk about the game, which I wasted 3+ years of my life. I gotta say that L4D2 is a very fun game to play especially with friends. But if you don't have any friends (like me) and you want to play this game, then... well... good luck then. And what I meant by that?Newbies are fine. If they're not deaf and can communicate, then it's absolutely fine to play with 'em. We can play slowly and help each other, help improve and have fun. If you're a newbie and want some help, then you have to be nice. Nobody wants to help rude people with no manners.Try-hards ARE not fine. They're everywhere and if you happen to ♥♥♥♥ up somewhere while playing with 'em. You'll get kicked out from the game without hesitation. The community is getting more and more ♥♥♥♥♥ier. Also, if you enjoy playing on expert, then you'll definitely meet some ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s who just randomly joins the game, shoots everyone and leaves. I'm not even surprised anymore.What I want to say is please think twice, or even thrice, before buying this game. I love this game, but I highly recommend it to peeps who have friends to play with.  Unless you're prepared to get shot down by stupid players and then kicked out from the game.But there's chance that you'll meet good peeps who will probably help you improve. I even found server full of friendly Russians. Search for peeps who focuses on having fun rather than winning. It's not very often you get to meet nice, kind, great teamplayers. But once you do, then all the fun begins.

												It really is a fun game when you play with friends or others online. Your A.I. mates aren't really that smart and respond slow to most crucial timings. So definitely recommend you don't play alone. The Gameplay itself is repetitive but you almost never play the same level twice. what I mean is that one that it has a radomizer so you'll most likely never run into the same Tank (boss of the game) at the same spot. The characters are pretty cool to connect with and aren't annoying one bit. includes the campaigns from the original L4D game so that's a nice bonus ^_^ But what really kept me from contuneing playing was the Mods in the L4D2 workshop and through L4Dmaps.com. they have a HUGE amount of mods so you can customize pretty much anything from the game. The community is most of the time nice but I did ran into ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s who would kick me for not playing a certain instead of having some good ol fashion fun. overall, its a great game. I only wish Valve would release a Third game in my life time. 9/10 ^^"

												One of the most entertaining zombie apocalypse shooters I've ever played. It's got solid gameplay to keep you coming back to play it, and a really memorable cast. number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 6, 2010
												Left 4 Dead 2 is probably one of the most intensive co-op multiplayer fps you will ever play.  I have never played a game that was so rigidly dependant on good teamwork.  Campaign mode gets old after a while but Versus and Scavenge is where its at for competitive gameplay.  New mutations every week keep it fresh and interesting.  Would definitely recommend having a mic as a lot of the game requires you to be in constant communication with your team, particularly in modes like Realism Versus, where a micless player can be crippling for its team.  It seperates itself from the first Left 4 Dead in there being more maps, modes, special infected, and director dynamics, leading to a much more varied experience.  I would definitely recommend it to anyone who loves co-op gameplay!  This is a must have.

Posted: May 8, 2012
												I'm not a zombie lover, but this game is great. I love the teamwork (co-up), throwables and variety of weapons. The missions are great with various difficulty levels. Once you're chasing zombies in swamp areas, other times trying to collect enough gas to start up a car or trying to get through a very tall crop field in a storm. Weekly updates and best thing ever: mutation & versus mode(you can be the zombies attacking your friends or other players)!

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 7, 2014
												Warning : This will drag you in and hold you there , pounding you into submission over and over again and you'll love it.If you have never played anything like this before, it will probably only take you at the most 30 minutes to get the hang of. The plot is thin, like most zombie stuff. (Walking Dead exlcuded) Green Flu made it all happen. All hell broke loose and the outbreak quickly spread. You are a memeber of a group of survivors constantly chasing rescue points. Constantly chasing hope. Despite the fact that hope is brutally crushed most of the time. That's something I want to focus on here, as there have been numerous , brilliant reviews of this game. What really grabbed me was the never ending optimism of the characters in the game. No matter how many times they battle their way through hell and back, just to get to an escape point leading to a boat/bridge/helicopter/train etc, it always goes wrong and lands them some where else but in the same situation. This becomes more extreme, and literal, if you play in survivor mode. It's not whether you survive but how long you survive for. Not so long ago computer games were all about winners and losers. Great sparkly rewards as the world is saved and celebrations are had all round. This game takes us back to the old days of Asteroids and Space Invaders. You know you will always die. Some times very quickly. Perseverance, endurance and dogged determination to team work and strategy are the only way to survive in this cold and bleak world. Cooperative playing. Mutual aid. Survival of the fittest is no longer the carrion call, now it is survival of the most organised and cohesive. It's understandable that this game is so addictive. In modern day society , 'wealth for self above every one else' is the motto of the day. Creating such a fun and excting world where working together as packs/ tribes is innately appealing to our species nature. Which explains much of the massive multi online gaming  team games appeal. Once you start playing around with the community mods you enter a whole new world every single game. Aliens instead of common infected, predators as Hunters. You can even play in Mario World with Mario characters if you so choose. No ? Then maybe play as 4 raptors armed to the teeth in the midst of a zombie apocalypse. Still not enough ? How about defending Helms Deep with all of the bells and whistles of the Tolken world ? There's even an RPG single player mod. It has been over 5 years since I last invested so much time into a game. Never have I done that with an online game until now. You probably all ready own this , so you get how cool it is. Punt me a message if you wanna defend Helms Deep in survival mode some time :)See y'all in the apocalypse !

												My L4D2 review.-The graphics look great even after 6 years.-Lots of great user created content (mods aka addons).-Lots of replay values.-Dedicated servers.-Modded servers.-Best enjoyed with friends.-Play the single campaign first if new to the game. -Look up tips  against the special infected (si). -Some veterans will help you...others will not. -Beware of griefers & pubstompers (block them to avoid any future encounters).-Useless bot survivors (fixable with addons).-Terrible community.

content:
Posted: December 19, 2013
												This is the kind of game that you can play for hours and hours, and never really get tired of it. It's a great way to relieve some stress after a long day; just grab a drink, take a seat, and destroy masses of zombies. Most of the various game modes are pretty fun, and of course, it only gets better if you have a couple friends to play with online. Classic source engine graphics, tons of add-on items, maps, and campaigns, of which many can be found right here in the Steam Workshop. Endless fun, near-infinite add-ons, a great community, and at the end of the day, arguably the best zombie apocolypse first person shooter on the current market. Buy it.

content:
Posted: August 17, 2016
Product received for free
												I enjoy this game, especially with friends. You get to kick back, and massacre zombies, or struggle through, and triumph over adversity, depending on the difficulty. The different types of special infected present different obstacles, and make it much more interesting than any old plain zombie shooter. Granted the game is kinda old, but it still has quite the following!    If you are new to the game, I'd stay away from Realism mode/Advanced Difficulty/Expert Difficulty/Versus (the highly competetive, and difficult PvP aspect) And Scavenge (Like VS, but you have to collect gas cans, while fighting off the infected). At least until you know where you're going/how to deal with all the specials/have friends to play with so you don't get votekicked/and have a decent amount of experience with the game. (Just because those modes can have an unforgiving community, and will scare you off from playing it again...) If you do start out on those modes, I'd HIGHLY suggest doing it with friends first, so you can get a feel for it before going to public games, where people are often criticizing over the littlest mistakes.  If you don't wanna spend much money, wait until it goes on sale.If you want it FOR FREE wait until the holidays around december, when it's at no cost to you. Get your friends to get it then, and you can have a blast together!  It has Workshop Support, so you can have different music, weapon/item/character skins, and new maps, and gamemodes too!  If you don't know whether you want this game or not, ask a friend, or get it around Christmas for free, and if you don't like it, you'll have lost nothing! Lastly: Don't get discouraged if people are talking crap about you, or if you're having trouble playing. Make an effort to play better, smarter, and have a decent mic!  Overall I LOVE playing this with friends, because there's no pressure. When you and your buddies can defeat public teams in vs, or make people ragequit, you'll feel great about your accomplishments. Keep at it, and you'll get better!  Also check out some guides! My friend has some informative quides, and here's the link for some of them!http://steamcommunity.com/id/LarryShadowGhostDyes/myworkshopfiles/?section=guidesI hope you enjoy L4D2, and hope you become a great player someday! Maybe I'll see you in a VS match... Best of luck!

												I have to say, I enjoy building shelter just as the next guy, but this game has scarred me for life. I used to think of Left 4 Dead 3 as a fun game, occasionally going out to go mining with my friends from daycare, crafting wood swords, killing sheep, and such. But the amount of vending machines in this game is just too darn high. I try to eat healthy, keeping a strict diet to make sure I don't get too slippery. I Ocassionally go out for breakfast at Pizza Hut (around 2 or 3 times a week) but the sugary drinks in this game make it unfathomably hard to keep it fresh. Please, not just for me, but for the dogs too, take out sugary drinks from this game. Not only does it make you slippery, but a recent article has linked soda drinks to autism. This isn't just for me, but also the dogs that are fed soda each and everyday. Overall solidy bad of a greatly bad good game.

With a huge amount of Custom campaigns and maps put out by the community, its difficult to not play it every so often.The real kicker is the community, since there is either the newbies who just wanna learn, the griefing cretins that just pop in and out and get mad when they get a votekick on them, the try hards that got hacks up and boost about how 'good' they are (and ragequit when they get steamrolled), and then theres everyone else that just plays it for FUN. Trolling abound, and since it's gone F2P for a few days at a time or completely free, grief♥♥♥♥♥♥♥jump onto creating accounts just to be jackasses.It's an endless ♥♥♥♥♥torm and hard to find a public game without ♥♥♥♥-wits and whiny babies.If your new to it, please try single player campaign first, so you get a hang of most of the maps and won't get screamed at by whiny babies that rather kick than play nice.

Posted: April 15, 2014
												I, Like many others I know, have spent hundreds and hundreds of hours playing this game, and this is why. Left 4 Dead brings the best combination of Cooperative team play, gore, content and fun all into one package. I have NEVER come across such a repetitive game, but have each time I play it bring something new, and partnered with the steam workshop, I can Customise my game how I like it to make the experience even better. Allthough there are glitches here and there, and the occasional crash, I love it, and will continue to play it, regardless of new releases... unless of course L4D3 comes out... there's a game that needs to be released... In terms of online play, You'll meet the occasional imbecile, but where don't you? Versus is the game mode I play most. The fact you get to be a special infected is epic, but only when you don't get killed xD I recommend this game to anyone. It is seriously awesome.

content:
Posted: February 26, 2014
This review is a little lengthy, so if you just want to know why I recommend this game skip the Results and read from there.Valve produces one of the most rigorous zombie games ever created. This fantastic first person shooter offers co-operative play which puts you right in the apocalypse that really keeps you on the run. Story:Left 4 Dead 2 places you as a character in a movie: Louis, Zoey, Francis, Bill, Coach, Ellis, Nick or Rochelle. Each level is suppose to be a part of a movie which combines into a single story. There are two stories which involve the first four characters or the latter. Eventually the characters from each movie integrate and intermingle joining the two movies together as one. There is a clear start and finish to the story, but as you play the maps online the story gets conveluded and lost. But if you play the campaign in order you will notice connections between all the maps that drive the characters to a set objective. Left 4 Dead 2 is a movie and as such the characters are unrealistically attributed with super human strength, unrealistic accuracy, and cheesy lines all of which are similar to most action movie stars.Campaign:Left 4 Dead 2 drops you right into a zombie apocalypse. The campaign consists of both Left 4 Dead 2 and remastered Left 4 Dead levels. The included campaigns are: No Mercy, Crash Course, Death Toll, Dead Air, Blood Harvest, The Sacrifice, Dead Center, The Passing, Dark Carnival, Swamp Fever, Hard Rain, The Parish, and Cold Stream. This can be expanded upon with hundreds of maps created using the editor which sometimes are better constructed than the originals. The brilliance behind this game is that due to a basic AI instructor the zombie placement changes every time you play a level which produces high replay value.Modding:Not only can you replay the included levels a plethora of times without being bored, but the workshop allows you to expand upon that and download new maps and mods that make the game better with every adjustment. You can even go to certain websites and download maps created by the community there. I personally prefer to download my maps from community websites as they are easier to install from the website. If you like fast paced zombie games and have some friends to play with this is the game for you. Gameplay:Left 4 Dead 2 is a fast paced Zombie first person shooter that involves running between areas to safe houses. Each level has chapters which you must run through, these chapters can either be incredibly long or ridiculously short. You have the choice to take it slow and work your way through the levels in time, or go as fast as you can. Typically teams that go slow do worst because as time progresses they must face more enemies than quicker teams. Hordes of fast moving zombies spawn in ways that can seem endless. Like most zombie games a headshot is much more effective than a chest shot, but enemies can still be taken down either way. Multiplayer:One of the epic features about this series is the online multiplayer. In this mode you are pitted as teams undead or survivors. The undead spawn as special zombies and must collaborate to kill off the survivors. Survivors on the other hand must complete objectives or finish chapters without all being perished. The multiplayer is brilliant, although it can be a little less fun if you don’t have someone to play with as this is a heavily team based game. Results:If you love zombie games, you like co-op experiences, you understand how to install mods, you just want to be an action hero, or even you just want to play by yourself Left 4 Dead 2 is the game for you. The amazing AI director makes the same map different every time. The bots although not the smartest can make a single player experience fun, and with some mods you can easily switch between players and control the bots if you accidently die. The game is an amazing action thriller that keeps you on your toes and constantly wanting more. Pros:+Four player co-op campaigns that last at most one hour each+Good graphics and smooth animations+Fantastic zombie feel without seeming too mind-numbing (making zombies intelligent and tactful)+Fun campaigns that blow away realism and just create action packed fun.+Workshop compatible allowing for large amounts of mods and customization+Basic AI so you can play with a single friend without having to join a game onlineCons:-Mods are not perfect and can cause the game to crash (so remember what you installed before each play-through in order to remove defective files)-Bots are essentially mentally handicapped even with Bot Mods-Bots will not use the defibrillator unit-When playing single player the human player cannot switch between bots in order to continue enjoying the game despite their own demise-Some weapons seem excessive and worthless (two different types of pump shotguns)-Poor servers in comparison to the Xbox 360 (I miss mod free servers)

												I have to say, I enjoy building shelter just as the next guy, but this game has scarred me for life. I used to think of Left 4 Dead 3 as a fun game, occasionally going out to go mining with my friends from daycare, crafting wood swords, killing sheep, and such. But the amount of vending machines in this game is just too darn high. I try to eat healthy, keeping a strict diet to make sure I don't get too slippery. I Ocassionally go out for breakfast at Pizza Hut (around 2 or 3 times a week) but the sugary drinks in this game make it unfathomably hard to keep it fresh. Please, not just for me, but for the dogs too, take out sugary drinks from this game. Not only does it make you slippery, but a recent article has linked soda drinks to autism. This isn't just for me, but also the dogs that are fed soda each and everyday. Overall solidy bad of a greatly bad good game.

content:
Posted: June 13, 2015
												This is one of the best games I've ever played. If you like teamplay in an FPS, you want to own this game! Teamplay is obligatory, meaning one strong carry can usually not win this game by himself, as it is possible in many other competitive games. This is especially true for versus mode, in which four survivors play against four special infected.Because of the emphasis on teamplay, the community is rather unwelcoming towards beginners. Especially in versus mode, new players will be kicked before they know it. I recommend a few hundred hours of campaign playing to every newbie.10/10: You can survive the zombie apocalypse with a frying pan.

content:
Posted: August 17, 2016
Product received for free
												I enjoy this game, especially with friends. You get to kick back, and massacre zombies, or struggle through, and triumph over adversity, depending on the difficulty. The different types of special infected present different obstacles, and make it much more interesting than any old plain zombie shooter. Granted the game is kinda old, but it still has quite the following!    If you are new to the game, I'd stay away from Realism mode/Advanced Difficulty/Expert Difficulty/Versus (the highly competetive, and difficult PvP aspect) And Scavenge (Like VS, but you have to collect gas cans, while fighting off the infected). At least until you know where you're going/how to deal with all the specials/have friends to play with so you don't get votekicked/and have a decent amount of experience with the game. (Just because those modes can have an unforgiving community, and will scare you off from playing it again...) If you do start out on those modes, I'd HIGHLY suggest doing it with friends first, so you can get a feel for it before going to public games, where people are often criticizing over the littlest mistakes.  If you don't wanna spend much money, wait until it goes on sale.If you want it FOR FREE wait until the holidays around december, when it's at no cost to you. Get your friends to get it then, and you can have a blast together!  It has Workshop Support, so you can have different music, weapon/item/character skins, and new maps, and gamemodes too!  If you don't know whether you want this game or not, ask a friend, or get it around Christmas for free, and if you don't like it, you'll have lost nothing! Lastly: Don't get discouraged if people are talking crap about you, or if you're having trouble playing. Make an effort to play better, smarter, and have a decent mic!  Overall I LOVE playing this with friends, because there's no pressure. When you and your buddies can defeat public teams in vs, or make people ragequit, you'll feel great about your accomplishments. Keep at it, and you'll get better!  Also check out some guides! My friend has some informative quides, and here's the link for some of them!http://steamcommunity.com/id/LarryShadowGhostDyes/myworkshopfiles/?section=guidesI hope you enjoy L4D2, and hope you become a great player someday! Maybe I'll see you in a VS match... Best of luck!

content:
Posted: March 25, 2016
 So where do I even begin with this so called review? Left 4 Dead 2 is my most played game by a  large  margin. A  very large  margin. I enjoy the game, I do. Something always brings me back to it. It's got a charm that no other games seems to have for me. The lore, the characters, the locations. Most of them are fantastic, yes. With the help of modders and their handy mods, this is increased tenfold and it's  bloody  amazing. Then there's the community.  Now, if people are reading this, most of them would probably be shaking their heads in disgust at the word "community"Yes, a large number of the Left 4 Dead 2 community, isn't really all that great. I could get into why but Im not going to get in to that. Find the right community however and pretty soon, Left 4 Dead 2 can become your own story.  I have made  friends , I have made  enemies  and I have even found someone who is  very special to me. There are downsides of course but whatever happens, I find myself coming back to this game. And I find myself thinking its more for the people than for the game itself. Don't get me wrong, I love the game too. So, if you're reading this and you're thinking of purchasing it, then please do. It should be a mandatory game with every Steam account. Dont be put off when you join a game and people start shouting and voting for you to be kicked. Take a breath, quit and try again cause I promise you, you'll find something to love with this game and with its community. You'll make friends and yes, you might make enemies too but then again, it'd be boring if someone didnt hate you, right?So to cut it short,  Yes  this game is what you want.  I do hope you enjoy your stay

Posted: July 3, 2015
												My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately.'. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 28, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this game gave me cancer anyway.

In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, salt, and baking soda.    Using an electric mixer, beat the butter and sugars on medium-high speed until fluffy, 2 to 3 minutes. One at a time, beat in the eggs, then the vanilla. Reduce speed to low and gradually add the flour mixture, mixing until just combined (do not overmix). Mix in the chocolate chips and nuts (if desired) by hand.    Drop heaping tablespoonfuls of the dough onto baking sheets, spacing them 2 inches apart.    Bake, rotating the baking sheets halfway through, until golden around the edges but still soft in the center, 12 to 15 minutes. Cool slightly on the baking sheets, then transfer to wire racks to cool completely. Store the cookies in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 5 days.

												Changing my review, still a thumbs up.This is a fun game to play, as long as you use common sense on some things. Like don't jump into a versus game when you barely know the maps. People are pretty kick friendly if you mess up too much. So practice with friends, or single player. If you get the basics but don't like single player then play easy or normal campaigns.Rushing in a advanced, realism, or versus game before you are ready will end up with just a lot of kicks and rage. I personally beat higher difficulty on single player before ever touching it online.(example: I beat advanced alone, before advanced online.)Still a great game, if you work as a team.

number of helpful: 5 of 7 people (71%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 3, 2012
												Left 4 Dead 2 is a great game. I've had tons of hours of fun playing through campaigns and versus matches with my friends and still come back to play a round or two from time to time. It does however have some rather notable deficiencies the some important of which is, it's not that big of an upgrade from Left 4 Dead 1. Although the basic versus and campaigns play quite differently this is the result of new infected classes being added on rather than anything being changed, the result being that some of the older infected classes have become almost obsolete.Also something worth highlighting is Valve's inefficiency at fixing bugs. Several years into the game's life with almost weekly updates and Tanks still sometimes spawn outside of the map or on top of burning barrels.I guess my main criticism of Left 4 Dead 2 isn't that it's a bad game. It is that it's not a full game. It's a stand alone expansion pack and the fact that Valve charged full price is nothing short of a money grab.
