number of helpful: 5 of 7 people (71%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 26, 2013
												Even though this game is over 4 years old it still holds up as being one of, if not THE best zombie game on the market. It's not only fun playing single player but it's hilarious when you can get three more friends to join in the zombie killing.There's of course the standard Easy - Hard difficulities (Here being Easy, Medium, Advanced and Expert). So if you're looking for some mindless slaughtering to do you can put it on easy or if you and your friends is a tatical squad preparing for the zombie apacolypse this is a great way to start!Also you don't have to play the first game to get into this one, all the maps and more from the first game is in this one. Even if you want to play oldschool there is a mode for that. Speaking of modes, there's Versus mode which is exactly what it sounds like, you control both the infected and the survivors in rounds. The one who ends the final map with the most points win. There is also a realism version of this mode which means the survivers can't see the green/orange/red glow around them as they used to.There's also Survival which is aslo what it sounds like. Survive for X amount of time and you get bronze, silver or a gold medal depending on the requirments for the map you're playing.Scavanger is the last major gamemode, here you play as survivor and infected and the objective is to fill a generator with gas. Who wins depends on which team's the fastest.Then, finally, there's something called mutation. These are pretty much fun little mini modes. For example you have to try and survive an entire campaign on your own, you and all your teamates have katanas and can't get other weapons, you need to carry around a lawngnome to win etc.

number of helpful: 5 of 7 people (71%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 30, 2014
												-=-Hello! If anyone has read my reviews in the past, I'd just like to let you know that I follow a consistent pattern of playing at least 10 hours of any game I choose to review. So, without further ado, my Left 4 Dead 2 Review.-=-As many of you know, this game was made by Valve, shortly after Valve purchased Turtle Rock Studios, the developer of the first game. Now, Valve makes very great quality games, and if that doesn't interest you enough, I encourage you to continue reading my review.Now, I admit to not having finished the campain yet, but I've witnessed enough zombie slaughter to deem this game worthy of one of the best games I've played. This game is awesome; I've had fun slicing heads of zombies off with a fireaxe time and time again.This game was created in 2009, and the graphics, while cartoony, are very fantastic. The characters look amazing, the zombies look amazing, and hey, even the environment is eye-candy. The campaign is long, and I don't mean that in a bad way; each mission takes about 41 minutes long; and there's 9-10 levels. Each level, or chapter, is composed of 3-4 different areas, which you have to navigate through the zombie horde to reach a safehouse to end each segment. With the dark atmospheres and seemingly easy combat, you can sit back, relax, and shoot or slice your way through the zombies.The zombies are very well made; they're all creepy, and they're all wearing different clothes. This is one of the only zombie games I've played where everyone doesn't look like clones. With regular zombies, there's specialty zombies; Hazmats, who don't take fire damage, Chargers, who charge at you, Witches, who are one hit kill creatures that are extremely disturbing, Tanks, who take a hit and look pretty neat, Spitters, who launch poisonous goo at your team's feet,  and Boomers, which will blow up and blind your character; the blinding attracts other zombies which means the horde's now directed at you.The workshop mods are plentiful. Yes, this game does have a workshop, which makes the game that much more interesting. You can fight Teletubbies as Deadpool and Lara Croft. You can change Pills into Cola, and so on and so on. With the different survival maps you can download, the game may never be boring for survival lovers.Which leads me to my next point; survival. You don't have to do campaign mode all the time in Left 4 Dead 2, instead you can face large battles of horde after horde, trying to beat your team's best time. It adds a challenge to survival so that you have something to beat.Now for the breakdown:PROS:-Geniously Made (It's Valve: Duh)-Fantastic Graphics-Not that old of a game-Awesome enemies we can all learn to hate-Generous Replayability-Not a cheap ripoff of any gameCons:-Slight bugs; Zombies floating above cars a couple inches, etc, doesn't affect gameplay, just slightly distracting.9.5/10. Best game I've played in a long time.Also! There's Mods that can disable the profanity, turn the blood into paintball paint, etc, so if you were debating to purchase this game, there's mods for everything!!

number of helpful: 5 of 7 people (71%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 31, 2014
												Before I even knew what Steam was, Left 4 Dead 1 and 2 were very popular games that I would play with my friends - back in our internet cafe days. I got this game gifted to me, and loved being able to add it to my collection.If you like the zombie-theme, fast-paced gameplay, cooperative chaos, superior mod support, and hours of endless fun, then you will thoroughly enjoy this game. The aesthetics are fantastic - the detail in the environment and character models is great, and the available mods add massive variety to most elements of the game. The music and sounds are very good and add a lot to the atmosphere. Each level set follows a particular story, allowing you to predict the gameplay with a few playthroughs. The controls are straightforward for your typical first-person shooter (FPS), and there is always feedback provided to help you remember the keys and things you can interact with. The learning curve is minimal to moderate, depending on your experience with FPS games. There are variants that ramp up the difficulty accordingly, if you are itching for more of a challenge.The mod support is where this game truly shines - it is just as seamlessly integrated as Space Engineers and Starbound. For example, in my game the zombies have been replaced with bone-chilling Teletubbies, and my 4 survivors consist of Harley Quinn (Batman series), James Bond (Pierce Brosnan), Wrex (Mass Effect series), and Scout (Team Fortress 2). I've also swapped out the "special" zombie with other skins. You can also mod things like weapons, game variants, taunts, etc. The possibilities are near-endless, allowing you to tailor your experience as you see fit.Overall, the gameplay is very fun, and cooperative play with friends maximizes the playability of L4D2. The AI is pretty decent (mods increase their effectiveness), but nothing beats fighting through hordes of zombies with real people. A key mechanic in the game is defending a point while some event (ex: an alarm while you wait for an elevator) causes a huge horde to rush you. There are also parts where you must deliver an item to a different location (while you hold the item you cannot attack), again while you are attracting zombies.  Special zombies like the Tank and Witch add extra danger to the levels, as you will need both planning and teamwork to take them down efficiently.If you haven't had a chance to try this game and are even the least bit interested, you really must give it a chance. I think it will be difficult to NOT enjoy L4D2. Definitely recommend!Cheers,DJSF @DJSF's Rogue Reviews

												Changing my review, still a thumbs up.This is a fun game to play, as long as you use common sense on some things. Like don't jump into a versus game when you barely know the maps. People are pretty kick friendly if you mess up too much. So practice with friends, or single player. If you get the basics but don't like single player then play easy or normal campaigns.Rushing in a advanced, realism, or versus game before you are ready will end up with just a lot of kicks and rage. I personally beat higher difficulty on single player before ever touching it online.(example: I beat advanced alone, before advanced online.)Still a great game, if you work as a team.

content:
Posted: June 12, 2012
												Left 4 Dead 2 is THE game for online co-op first person shooting. And it never gets old, because you can vote; change the difficulty setting on the fly, or vote-kick that annoying team killer [which they are rare simply because they get vote-kicked lickety split.] Also you can visit www.l4dmaps.com and download user made content like Suicide Blitz, City 17, and I Hate Mountains! This game still gets regular updates and weekly mutations such as Chainsaw Masacre or Flu Season or The Four Swordsmen... all for the low low price of $0/month. If you want some co-op action without all the tedious grinding and boring leveling and repetitve end game content of an MMO, Left 4 Dead 2 here on steam is THE place to be. gl, hf, and gg! [good luck, have fun, and good game!]

content:
Posted: October 27, 2013
												Left 4 Dead, in my opinion, is one of the few games that deserves a 10 out of 10. For what it is trying to do, it achieves it perfectly. This is the quiescental fast paced zombie survival game. Each of the campaigns have almost an infinite replay value, with a multitude of modifiers. Survival mode is addicting, and versus is unique and awesome. In versus, you can play as the infected, and try to hunt down the survivors. I have played this for 50 hours on steam, and hundreds more on consoles, and I still love it. Get this game.Pros:+Everything (One of the only games I consider to be perfect)Overall: 10/10 The perfect zombie Coop game, get it now.

content:
Posted: December 20, 2014
												Left for dead 2OH WOWWhere do I start with this amazing game.Well,let's start with the basics,Left for dead 2,or l4d2 for short,is the sequal to yet another amazing game l4d.This pits the charactersCoachA Varsity football coach who is like the team pep-cheerleader. Giving the team encouraging words whenever they are incacpitated or ''hurt''. He also acts like the team leader. He is very good at keeping the teams level-headed.RochelleThe most hated character of l4d2 for a lot of people for no apparent reason. Rochelle was a news worker who has to deal with Ellis,another character who is in love with her.EllisAs said before Ellis is in love with Rochelle. Ellis is like a texan who has a friend named Keith that he talks about so and so. He is like the clown of the group,giving them a good laugh sometimes.NickNick is a drug dealer.'Nuff said.But in all honesty Nick is the grump of the group. He was a con artist but he doesn't have as much known about him as everyone else.The new infected.From memory they added the SpitterThe spitter spits acid (Hence the name Spitter) Which can damage survivors and wittle down their health.ChargerThe charger is like the powerhouse of the infected. Able to charge a survivor and pummel them into seperate concrete areas.And there is the Jockey who when he jumps on your head can lead the survivor to different places,they can attempt to resist it but it nearly never walks. When they are Jockeyed they can lead them into a instant death charger area,spitters's spit or a instant witch.The game l4d2 is as good,dare I say it, better then it's first game. I believe the characters have more colour in there backstory and aren't just talking about the apocolypse but stuff that they remember and stuff about backstory.There are the Uncommen infected who basically are infected who are uncommen,I know.Amazing,anyway There is the CEDA Worker Infected who are immune to bile bombs. The Jimmy Gibsh Juinor infected,Fallen survivor who carries different supplies and drops them when killed. Clown infected,worker infected,and the riot infected.l4d2s' community could be better,so that's a dent in what is a perfect game otherwise.l4d2 9/10As I said before,the community could be better.I will add the different modes and more detail later as I have to go now.

												I had a lot of fun playing this game although I do not take it much seriously (if any at all) but of course I votekick those who just ruin the game or do not play as intended but never had issues if someone or even the entire team has low skill level as I do not play for win, just play to have fun so even when we lost but everyone tried was satisfactory for me. I haven't played it since quite some time and I heard the playerbase now is horrible, unforgiving and ruthless so consider this when you plan to play it and if you can gather a group of friends to play with instead of going alone or with just one friend. I mostly played public games alone back then and had only a slight amount of issues with trolls and tryhards so it was okay at that time but things have changed a lot (to the worse) according to my sources so if that is a concern to you be prepared or just play another game.

												A real "must-have" for the lovers of zombie games. One of the best co-op games, where you have to help each other and work as a team in order to survive. number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 22, 2014
												One of the greatest co-op experiences I've ever had the pleasure to play. If you're even remotely interested in cooperative games, post-apocalyptic settings, or something as simple as a solid and fun FPS, you can't go wrong with Left 4 Dead 2.First off, the gameplay: in a word, it's fantastic. You can play a variety of gamemodes including Campaign (humans against AI), Versus (humans against humans), Survival, and more. So whether you're the competitive or the casual type, there's a gamemode for you. Playing as a survivor, the guns feel great, killing zombies feels satisfying, and the need for teamwork is an absolute must. As an infected, the zombies feel unique, isolating survivors feels satisfying, and the need for teamwork is an absolute must. Without going in to too much detail, this really is co-op at its finest.On the other side of the coin, there is little-to-no story to speak of, so don't go in expecting a plot. You can, however, count on a diverse cast of memorable characters. Valve managed to create distinguished and vibrant personalities of the game's eight playable protagonists from nothing but simple back-and-forth dialogue and banter. It keeps things fresh, interesting, and humorous, even after 700 hours of gametime.Left 4 Dead 2 easily stands as one of my favorite multiplayer games of all time.

												I love playing this game. This is the best zombie game, besides Call of Duty: World at War, Black Ops, and Black Ops II Zombies, and The House/Typing of the Dead: Overkill. When I first played this game I thought it was a terrible, boring game, but once you keep playing, then you'll realize that especially with your friends, this is a very fun game to play. Still boring? Well, then go mod your game with Steam Workshop items, like maps, character skins, camos, other weapons and sounds as well! Anyway, if you don't have the game, grab a copy, and also try to gift copies of the game to friends that don't have it!! Enjoy this game now, and you won't regret it! PS: DO NOT get Left 4 Dead 1. number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
												Grab some friends and settle in for one of the all-time great co-op games. While this game can be played alone or with random strangers on the internet, you're only going to get the full experience playing with 3 friends. On top of that some sort of voice communication is crucial, whether it's in-game voice chat or playing in the same room. You fight through waves of zombies, interspersed with tougher "special" infected, trying to reach a series of safe houses and eventually escape. Along the way you'll have to complete occasional specific objectives, most commonly fetch quests and wave defense/horde mode. You'll skimp on ammo and hunt for med-kits. You'll try to not wake the Witch. You'll wake the Witch. You'll fail, formulate new strategies, and tweak those again. It's all of this that makes your final escape so exhilarating and fulfilling.On top of the great co-op campaign levels you also get co-operative and versus multiplayer modes. Of course you have your basic horde mode but really intriguing are the versus modes where teams switch back and forth between playing the survivors and the infected. When playing as an infected you spawn as a different "special" infected, with it's special abilities and attacks, each life and try to stop the survivors from progressing through a stage or collecting gas cans to power a generator. Surviving with your friends is awesome, sending them to the moon as a Charger is hilarious. Extending the life of this title even more is the extensive Steam Workshop support. From simple visual changes and user maps to complete overhauls and re-skins, you should be able to find plenty of content to extend your playtime.If you have a few friends to play this with then it's absolutely worth the price, on-sale or not. If you're a lone wolf then you'll probably want to pass (playing alone isn't really that great) or make some friends.

Posted: December 26, 2015
												First off, I'm gonna be honest with this. There is alot wrong with this game. Infact, there is some stuff in this game that if you saw it, it'd make you just say "What in the ♥♥♥♥ were they thinking?". However, these things don't ruin the game, L4D2 is actually a very fun and addictive game with a huge amount of customization thanks to community made addons and mods. As I mentioned before, there are alot of bugs in this game, but the majority of them have had community made fixes, so that isn't too big of a problem, but it is still very lazy of valve to not fix these blatant bugs themselves. Over all, left 4 dead 2 is a very fun game that will definitely keep you from getting bored.

												This is a fantastic zombie based game. There are numerous con's to this game, like hacked or nodded lobbies that ruin the game IMO. And simply people that troll just a toxic community, but what game doesn't have that? Besides it being repetitive its a lot more fun with friends. There are a lot more pros such as destroying people with your friends or very rarely unless your♥♥♥♥♥♥vice versa. Lmao. There are configs in l4d2. Which allow you to participate in "promod" it's a style of vs that makes the game more challenging for survivors. Not just rush to saferoom deal. You are restricted to T1 only and pills. Mollies and pipe bombs and boomer biles are just more uncommon to find. It makes the game more intense the higher tiers you go up, steam groups are how you get into promod servers. Or you can join off of a friend that's in a good. All together if you see this game on sale. I highly reccomend it especially if you enjoy FPS that have some strategy especially if you play with friends or people that aren't as toxic as the community. 10/10 have bought this game twice. Worth it. All the way.

												A real "must-have" for the lovers of zombie games. One of the best co-op games, where you have to help each other and work as a team in order to survive. And if the official content is not enough for you, there are dozens of fan-made workshop maps, campaigns, weapons, skins, etc. Awesome games, I can only recommend it.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 22, 2014
												One of the greatest co-op experiences I've ever had the pleasure to play. If you're even remotely interested in cooperative games, post-apocalyptic settings, or something as simple as a solid and fun FPS, you can't go wrong with Left 4 Dead 2.First off, the gameplay: in a word, it's fantastic. You can play a variety of gamemodes including Campaign (humans against AI), Versus (humans against humans), Survival, and more. So whether you're the competitive or the casual type, there's a gamemode for you. Playing as a survivor, the guns feel great, killing zombies feels satisfying, and the need for teamwork is an absolute must. As an infected, the zombies feel unique, isolating survivors feels satisfying, and the need for teamwork is an absolute must. Without going in to too much detail, this really is co-op at its finest.On the other side of the coin, there is little-to-no story to speak of, so don't go in expecting a plot. You can, however, count on a diverse cast of memorable characters. Valve managed to create distinguished and vibrant personalities of the game's eight playable protagonists from nothing but simple back-and-forth dialogue and banter. It keeps things fresh, interesting, and humorous, even after 700 hours of gametime.Left 4 Dead 2 easily stands as one of my favorite multiplayer games of all time.

Posted: January 6, 2016
												This game is good in and of itself but I would only suggest you play the co-op mode with people you know.  9 times out of 10, you put 1 pinky toe wrong and you can expect to get kicked and sent back to the title screen.  This is probably true of most online games, but this one especially since there is no kind of moderation in the online play.  If you wanna play through the story with some friends, by all means pick this up, but I'd suggest you avoid the online pvp modes unless you are extremely patient, or have some kind of aiming assisting tool.

content:
Posted: February 5, 2014
												I love playing this game. This is the best zombie game, besides Call of Duty: World at War, Black Ops, and Black Ops II Zombies, and The House/Typing of the Dead: Overkill. When I first played this game I thought it was a terrible, boring game, but once you keep playing, then you'll realize that especially with your friends, this is a very fun game to play. Still boring? Well, then go mod your game with Steam Workshop items, like maps, character skins, camos, other weapons and sounds as well! This is worth the $19.99, but I recommend waiting till' Christmas becuase on Christmas they give this game for FREE, which I did. Anyway, if you don't have the game, grab a copy, and also try to gift copies of the game to friends that don't have it!! Enjoy this game now, and you won't regret it! PS: DO NOT get Left 4 Dead 1. ALL Left 4 Dead 1 campaigns are in Left 4 Dead 2.
